San Ignacio (Belize).title: San Ignacio (Belize)
San Ignacio (Belize).summary: San Ignacio is a small town in the Cayo region of Belize. San Ignacio, or Cayo as it is called, is located on the Macal river, and makes a good and affordable base for exploration of the stunning regions around it, with plenty of day trips to be taken and several decent tour guides willing to take you. It's also an important transit town en route to or from Guatemala.
San Ignacio (Belize).description: Known as Cayo to locals, Maya and Hispanic influence near the Guatemala border

Tikal.title: Tikal
Tikal.summary: Tikal is a large archaeological site in the Guatemalan department of Petén. During the Classic Period it was one of the largest and most important of the Mayan cities. Today it's one of the most fascinating and enjoyable of the Mayan sites to visit, largely due to its remoteness, but also its jungle setting. Tourists still descend on it by the busload, but it's far from feeling overrun like Chichen Itza and other sites. Some of the temples are still being uncovered, and you can watch archaeologists busy at work. It was designated a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1979.
Tikal.description: long considered the largest of Maya ruins (although the ongoing investigations of El Mirador may challenge this claim), this huge and impressive ancient Maya site is probably worth the trip to Guatemala by itself. Stay in the park or in nearby Flores the night before in order to organise an early morning trip to Tikal, to see the sun rise over the ruins. Tours are easily organised from the surrounding areas.

San Francisco.title: San Francisco
San Francisco.summary: The centerpiece of the Bay Area, San Francisco is one of the most visited cities in the world, and with good reason. The cultural center of northern California, San Francisco is renowned for its mixture of scenic beauty and unique culture that makes it one of the most vibrant and desirable cities in the nation, if not the world.
sights: Yerba Buena Center for the Arts
San Francisco.description: the City by the Bay, featuring the Golden Gate Bridge, vibrant urban neighborhoods, dramatic fog and high technology

Cancún.title: Cancún
Cancún.summary: Situated on the northeast tip of Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula, Cancún is a popular Caribbean tourist destination. Next to 22 km (14 miles) of beaches, you'll find a wide variety of resorts, spas, clubs, and malls.

links.text: Turicun (Transportacion Turistica y Urbana de Cancun)

Cancún.description: One of the worlds most popular and famous beaches, known for its clear Caribbean waters, its lively party atmosphere, and its wealth of recreational facilities.  During the U.S. college Spring Break (mid-Feb to the end of March) it is noted for drinking, sunburns, and debauchery.

Chetumal.title: Chetumal
Chetumal.summary: Chetumal is the capital of Quintana Roo in Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula. It is on the Bay of Chetumal, a sheltered inlet of the Caribbean Sea at the mouth of the Rio Hondo. This bay, together with the Rio Hondo, forms the border between Mexico and Belize.
Chetumal.description: city on the east coast of the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico

Dangriga.title: Dangriga
Dangriga.summary: Dangringa is a funky Garifuna town in Stann Creek, Belize. It looks a bit rough around the edges, but is home to some of the friendliest people you're likely to meet. If exploring Belize in any depth you're likely to come through here at least once en route to the south or to the southern cayes... spend a night if you've got the time.
Dangriga.description: Large Garifuna town in the south, formerly known as Stann Creek Town

Tulum.title: Tulum
Tulum.summary: Tulum is on the Yucatán Peninsula, in Mexico. It is one of the earliest resorts in Mexico, offering a place of worship and solitude for the Mayan kings, clergy and gods in early times. The tropical beach backdrop is the main attraction of this picturesque, much-visited small ruin on the shore of the Caribbean Sea. Shortly after your arrival, you will understand why early Mayans picked this beautiful place to relax.
Tulum.description: Mayan coastal city with spectacular Caribbean vistas. Dates from late Mayan period.

Sukhumi.title: Sukhumi
Sukhumi.summary: Sukhum (Abkhaz: Аҟəа /Aqwa/, Georgian: სოხუმი, Russian: Сухум) is the capital and principal city of Abkhazia. It has for the better part of the last century been famous throughout the former Soviet Union as a prominent subtropical beach resort, complete with palm trees, botanical gardens, and citrus plantations, backed by the high alpine peaks of the Greater Caucasus Mountains.

Pitsunda.title: Pitsunda
Pitsunda.summary: Pitsunda (Abkhaz: Пиҵунда) is a resort town in Abkhazia, 25 km away from Gagra.

Gagra.title: Gagra
Gagra.summary: Gagra is a town in Abkhazia, sprawling for 5 km on the northeast coast of the Black Sea, at the foot of the Caucasus Mountains.  Its subtropical climate made Gagra a popular resort.

New Athos.title: New Athos
New Athos.summary: New Athos (or Novy Afon) is a town on the Black Sea Coast of Abkhazia, northwest of Sukhumi.

Belize City.title: Belize City
Belize City.summary: Belize City is the largest city in Belize.  It is on a small peninsula protruding into the Caribbean Sea. It was the capital city until flooding and other damage from a hurricane in 1961 prompted the government to relocated to Belmopan, closer to the geographic center of the country.
Belize City.description: Belize's largest city, on the Caribbean Sea

Tobacco Caye.title: Tobacco Caye
Tobacco Caye.summary: Tobacco Caye is a tiny island off the coast of Belize, popular with budget travellers. Hammocks, novels, group meals and a healthy dose of snorkelling are likely to fill your day, on one of the few islands that won't break the bank in a country that normally excels at doing so.

Hopkins (Belize).title: Hopkins (Belize)
Hopkins (Belize).summary: Hopkins is a small village in Stann Creek in Belize with a long beach and access to the Belize Barrier Reef for snorkeling and diving, garifuna drumming, and nearby nature parks.

Caye Caulker.title: Caye Caulker
Caye Caulker.summary: Caye Caulker is a small island off the coast of Belize, 1.6 km (1 mi) west of the Barrier Reef.  It's about 8.2 km (5 mi) in length with a population of 1,300.
Caye Caulker.description: smaller barrier island in the north

Ambergris Caye.title: Ambergris Caye
Ambergris Caye.summary: Ambergris Caye is the largest of several hundred islands in the northernmost waters of Belize, Central America.  This simple island is a top destination in Belize for tourists worldwide,and its lack of high-rise hotels or big city public transportation gives the island a relaxed, laid-back feel.
Ambergris Caye.description: large barrier island in the north

Puerto Morelos.title: Puerto Morelos
Puerto Morelos.summary: Puerto Morelos is a town in Quintana Roo on the Yucatán Peninsula, about 20 km south of Cancún. It is a fishing village, and a resort and diving destination. It is roughly halfway between Cancún and Playa del Carmen on the Caribbean coast of the Yucatán Peninsula.  The pier in the center of town hosts snorkel and sport fishing boats while yachts dock in a man-made harbour just south of town.  The village used to be the embarkation point for the car ferry to Cozumel, but that now leaves from Calica, a major port south of Playa del Carmen.

Valladolid (Mexico).title: Valladolid (Mexico)
Valladolid (Mexico).summary: Valladolid is a small city in the state of Yucatán. Located about a 45 minute drive from the (lesser-used) east entrance of Chichén Itzá, it offers an alternative base for the ruins, while having its own charms as well -- although further from the ruins than the town of Piste, Valladolid is less tourist-oriented and has more historic charm.

Kabul.title: Kabul
Kabul.summary: Kabul has been the capital of Afghanistan since about 1776. The city was badly damaged during the various 1979–2001 wars, particularly its western parts. For a few years, Kabul has been going through a period of reconstruction and development, with some modern style tower blocks and a handful of glitzy shopping malls appearing over the last few years. Many roads, particularly the main feeder routes have been reconstructed and upgraded.  However, in outlying areas roads and other infrastructure remain in poor condition. Electricity supplies in Kabul are now quite reliable.
Kabul.description: in the east, the capital city

Ghazni.title: Ghazni
Ghazni.summary: Ghazni is a small city and province south of Kabul.
Ghazni.description: in the south-east, between Kabul and Kandahar

Bamiyan.title: Bamiyan
Bamiyan.summary: Bamiyan is the main town in Bamiyan Province.
Bamiyan.description: The remains of the Buddhas. Once considered one of the wonders of the world, these tall stone carvings were destroyed by the Taliban in a notorious act of cultural vandalism.

Ochamchire.title: Ochamchire
Ochamchire.summary: Ochamchire or Ochamchira (Abkhaz: Очамчыра, Georgian: ოჩამჩირე) is a small coastal town in Abkhazia.

Herat.title: Herat
Herat.summary: Herat (Dari: هرات) is a big, relatively wealthy city in western Afghanistan.
Herat.description: in the west, gateway to Iran, has a strong Persian influence and several interesting historical sites

Jalalabad.title: Jalalabad
Jalalabad.summary: Jalalabad (Pashto: جلال آباد) is a city in eastern Afghanistan with a population of nearly 900,000 people.
Jalalabad.description: in the east, between Kabul and the Khyber Pass

Kandahar.title: Kandahar
Kandahar.summary: Kandahar (Pashto: کندهار) is the capital of Kandahar province, and the largest city in Southern Afghanistan. Kandahar is also the second largest city in Afghanistan, and was the first capital of the modern state of Afghanistan in the 18th century.
Kandahar.description: a Taliban-influenced southern city, not safe for travel at this time

Kunduz.title: Kunduz
Kunduz.summary: Kunduz (Pashto: کندز; Persian: قندوز) also known as Kundûz, Qonduz, Qondûz, Konduz, Kondûz, Kondoz, or Qhunduz is a major city in the North of Afghanistan.
Kunduz.description: A major city in the northeast, and crossing point to Tajikistan

Balkh.title: Balkh
Balkh.summary: Balkh is a town in Afghanistan.
Balkh.description: Once one of the greatest cities in the region and capital of ancient Bactria. Although much of it lies in ruins, the remaining architectural and cultural elements remain little changed since Alexander the Great set foot there.

Mazar-e Sharif.title: Mazar-e Sharif
Mazar-e Sharif.summary: Mazar-e Sharif (مزار شریف), officially called Mazari Sharif and also Mazar-i-Sharif, Mazar-e Sharif, even Mazar Sharif or Mazar is a city in Afghanistan and the capital of Balkh Province.
Mazar-e Sharif.description: home to the impressively tiled Blue Mosque, and the staging point for trips into Uzbekistan

Band-e Amir National Park.title: Band-e Amir National Park
Band-e Amir National Park.summary: Band-e Amir National Park (Persian: بند امیر) is the first national park of Afghanistan. It is a stunning group of turquoise lakes in the Eastern zone of the country, in Bamyan Province. It sits high in the Hindu Kush at an altitude of 2900 m, and in 2013 about 6,000 local tourists visit the site each year. The area is protected by a small number of park rangers and most of the landmines are cleared.

Shëngjin.title: Shëngjin
Shëngjin.summary: Shëngjin is in Lezhë. Shëngjin is a growing beach town located in Northwest Albania well known for its Adriatic coastline and tourist accommodations. Shëngjin is quickly becoming one of the must see locations in Albania for day trippers or those looking for a relaxing getaway by the coast.
Shëngjin.description: A growing beach town located in northwest Albania known for its Adriatic Sea views.

Tirana.title: Tirana
Tirana.summary: Tirana (Albanian: Tiranë) is the bustling and modern capital of Albania.
Tirana.description: (Tiranë) — the capital. Trees and mountains surround the city. Mt. Dajt is a popular tourist site for a great view of the city.

Elbasan.title: Elbasan
Elbasan.summary: Elbasan is the city at the very center of Albania. Its central location, North to South and East to West, is the reason it is sometimes referred to as "Kërthiza e Shqipërisë" (The Bellybutton of Albania).
Elbasan.description: A large, poor, intriguing industrial city that is full of life. The market is fascinating, and the breakfast "Bugace" legendary. The Via Ignatia, an old Roman road to Istanbul, runs through the city.

Gjirokastër.title: Gjirokastër
Gjirokastër.summary: Gjirokastër is a town and a UNESCO world heritage site in Southeastern Albania.
Gjirokastër.description: another UNESCO city, located in the south is known for its unique Ottoman period architecture. There is a large castle on the hill in the middle of the city which served as a jail for many generations. A Military Museum and Art Gallery are now located inside.  Gjirokastër is also the birthplace of former communist Leader, Enver Hoxha, as well as Albania's most internationally famous author, Ismail Kadare, their homes now serve as museums.

Berat.title: Berat
Berat.summary: Berat is a city in Albania. In 2008 it was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site as it is a rare example of a well-preserved Ottoman town. It is one of the country's most beautiful towns, and is known as the "town of a thousand windows".
Berat.description: Thought to be one of the oldest towns in Albania, it is a new member of the UNESCO world heritage list.  Berat has long been known as the "city of 1001 windows" because of its unique Ottoman/Albanian architecture.  It has a well preserved castle with residents still living inside its protective walls.

Korçë.title: Korçë
Korçë.summary: Korçë (Korça) is the principal city in the district of Korçë in Southeastern Albania.
Korçë.description: (Korça) — Located in southeast Albania, several miles from the Greek border, this city is  full of life during the summer when you can find couples and families strolling through the city's main park, Parku Rinia. You can hike to the top of the beautiful mountain Moravia and view the city and its surrounding landscape.  Don't miss the Korça Brewery (famous throughout Albania) which sponsors a week long Beer Festival every August!

Shkodra.title: Shkodra
Shkodra.summary: Shkodra was the capital city of Albania for hundreds of years until 1915 when World War I broke out. Now it is the second largest city in Albania with 135,612 people. It has experienced a face lift as streets and buildings were renovated, a promenade opened and a new bridge built over the Buna River. Shkodra is 30 minutes away from the beach or 2 hours away from the mountains.
Shkodra.description: the biggest town in Northern Albania. Shkodra is considered the capital of Albanian culture. In Shkodra is located "Migjeni" theatre, the first in Albania and also was held the first cyclic race and also the first football match and the first photograph was developed (by Marubi). The Rozafa Castle is a major tourist attraction here,but also "The Great Cathedral", "The mosque Ebu Beker" etc.

Kruje.title: Kruje
Kruje.summary: Kruje, also Kruja in English, is a city in Albania just north of Tirana.
Kruje.description: (Krujë) — ancient city of the national hero Skanderbeg. It consists of beautiful mountains; Skanderbeg's castle is now a museum. Kruje also contains an old style bazaar with shops selling traditional goods amid cobblestone streets. Kruje is known for it's carpet craftworks.

Vlorë.title: Vlorë
Vlorë.summary: Vlorë is a city in Coastal Albania in Albania.
Vlorë.description: Lively seaside city, nice beaches south of town. Passenger ferries to and from Italy dock here.

Dhërmi.title: Dhërmi
Dhërmi.summary: Dhërmi is a village in Himarë Municipality in the Albanian Riviera part of Coastal Albania.
Dhërmi.description: one of the finest of the many beaches along the coastal road between Vlore and Saranda, perfect for camping.

Vuno.title: Vuno
Vuno.summary: Vuno is a village in Coastal Albania, located a few kilometres north to the town of Himarë.
Vuno.description: Small town feeling on the Albanian riviera

Albanian Riviera.title: Albanian Riviera
Albanian Riviera.summary: The Albanian Riviera (Albanian: Bregu) lies along the southwestern coast of Albania, from the village of Palasë and ending in Lukovë.
Albanian Riviera.description: Featuring crystal clear waters, unspoiled beaches, and picturesque villages, this is the Mediterranean coastline as it once was.

Pustec.title: Pustec
Pustec.summary: Pustec (Macedonian: Пустец) is one of the 61 municipalities of Albania, within Korçë County in the southeastern fringes of the country. It contains all of Albania's share of the Great Prespa Lake, as well as most of Prespa National Park which extends southward to Albania's portion of the Small Prespa Lake in Devoll Municipality. Home to an entirely ethnic Macedonian population and the only place in Albania where the ethnic group enjoys full minority rights, Pustec is considered the centre of the Macedonian minority of Albania. It encompasses much of a region known amongst Macedonians as "Mala Prespa", bordered by Greece to the east and by North Macedonia to the north and northeast.
Pustec.description: contains Albania's share of Lake Prespa, which forms Prespa National Park. This is also an area of much history, evidenced by the multiple cave churches found near its villages as well as on the island of Maligrad.

Ulcinj.title: Ulcinj
Ulcinj.summary: Ulcinj (Cyrillic: Улцињ, Albanian: Ulqin or Ulqini) is the most southern coastal town of Montenegro.

Podgorica.title: Podgorica
Podgorica.summary: Podgorica (Montenegrin: Подгорица) is the capital of Montenegro.

Kotor.title: Kotor
Kotor.summary: Kotor is a coastal town in Montenegro with a population of 23,500. It is known for its beautiful architecture and natural setting in the deepest part of a breathtaking bay.

Budva.title: Budva
Budva.summary: Budva is a coastal tourist resort in Montenegro. It is often called "Montenegrin Miami", because it is the most crowded and most popular tourist resort in Montenegro, with beaches and vibrant nightlife.

Corfu.title: Corfu
Corfu.summary: Corfu (Greek: Κέρκυρα, Kerkyra) is the northernmost of the Ionian Islands in Greece. Located off of the far northwest coast of the country, Corfu lies in the Adriatic sea, east of Italy and southwest of Albania. Historically Corfu has been controlled by many foreign powers, notably the Venetians, and British.
Corfu.description: Greek island in the Ionian Sea

Annaba.title: Annaba
Annaba.summary: Annaba is a coastal city in Northeast Algeria.
Annaba.description: A town with 200,000 inhabitants in the east of the country next to the border of Tunisia.

Algiers.title: Algiers
Algiers.summary: Algiers (الجزائر) is the capital of Algeria in North Africa.
Algiers.description: With nearly 3 million inhabitants, Algiers is the capital of Algeria, and the nation's political and cultural center.

Batna.title: Batna
Batna.summary: Batna is a city in Northeast Algeria.
Batna.description: main city of Batna Province, Algeria

Mendoza.title: Mendoza
Mendoza.summary: Mendoza is a city in western Argentina, in the desert Cuyo region. Mendoza is the center of the Argentinian wine industry, for which it is world renowned. It is also near the Aconcagua, the highest mountain outside of the Himalayas. Mendoza is the capital of the province of Mendoza.
Mendoza.description: well known for its extensive and high quality wine production. It is also near Aconcagua, the highest mountain outside of the Himalayas.

Rosario.title: Rosario
Rosario.summary: Rosario is the third largest city in Argentina and the largest city in Santa Fe province. It is located at the Paraná river, known for its rich architectonic heritage and beautiful riverside scenery, and offers a vibrant cultural and night life.

Salta.title: Salta
Salta.summary: Salta is the capital of the province of Salta, up in the mountains in northern Argentina. Salta is typically visited as a launching point for the nature and small towns in the region, but has its own charms and sights worth seeing too.
Salta.description: known as 'La Linda' due to its beautiful surroundings

Escaldes-Engordany.title: Escaldes-Engordany
Escaldes-Engordany.summary: Escaldes-Engordany is a parish (administrative division) mainly to the east of Andorra La Vella but with main village of the same name 1.6 km N of the capital of Andorra on the road to La Massana and Ordino.
Escaldes-Engordany.description: this is really an eastern suburb parish of Andorra La Vella

Ordino.title: Ordino
Ordino.summary: Ordino is the northernmost parish (administrative division) and town of Andorra between Andorra La Vella and France.  It has the fewest inhabitants of all Andorran parishes but covers almost the largest area.
Ordino.description: northernmost and least populated parish but almost the largest by area

Arinsal.title: Arinsal
Arinsal.summary: Arinsal is a village in Andorra, a small mountainous country in the Pyrenees mountains at the head of a valley. The old village part is clearly evident, but because it is also a ski resort it has grown a lot and has quite a number of hotels catering to this trade. As a result though outside the ski season the place is pretty much closed up including some of the bars and restaurants.
Arinsal.description: small village in the north west

Benguela.title: Benguela
Benguela.summary: Benguela is a city in Central Angola.
Benguela.description: the most tourist-friendly city in one of the world's least touristy countries, with a strong Carnavale tradition, pretty oceanfront, and by the nation's best beaches.

Luanda.title: Luanda
Luanda.summary: Luanda, the capital of Angola, is on the Atlantic coast. Its current renaissance is a truly inspiring success story. Decades of conflict, which only really ended in 2002, had long held Angola back. Since the start of the 21st century there has been a massive boom in construction in Luanda, where peace and stability have attracted numerous foreign companies to invest in offices in the city. The government of Angola, getting rich off revenue from oil, diamond, and other natural resources, is also investing heavily in and around Luanda, including large social housing high-rise blocks of flats to replace slums and existing dilapidated (and often bullet-ridden) tower blocks; extensive repaving; the construction of several six-lane highways leading out of the city; the reconstruction of railway lines leading out of the city; and a large new airport on the south side which had been set to open in 2011 but which is more than ten years in the making and still not open as of early 2016.
sights: Museu Nacional de História Natural de Angola
Luanda.description: the massive, overcrowded, chaotic, and incredibly expensive capital of the country, filled with nightlife and culture, a jarring mix of wealthy expats in the oil industry and the masses of destitute migrants from the rest of the country.

Huambo.title: Huambo
Huambo.summary: Huambo is a city in Central Angola, and capital of the Huambo Province. It is one of the largest provincial cities in Angola, comparable in size with Lubango and Lobito/Benguela.  Once called Nova Lisboa, it was designed in 1912 to be the new capital of Angola, and the beauty of that era is still apparent.  Angola's civil war took a massive toll on Huambo and its surrounding areas, leaving most buildings in the city full of bullet holes.  In recent years, reconstruction efforts have changed the face of the city, and the economy is booming as businesses reinvest.
Huambo.description: the center of the Ovimbundu region, one of Angola's larger cities that suffered greatly during the civil war, surrounded by much natural beauty.

Lobito.title: Lobito
Lobito.summary: Lobito is a city in Benguela Province, Angola.
Lobito.description: a beachfront city, basically part of Benguela, which is the epicentre of Carnavale celebrations.

M'banza-Kongo.title: M'banza-Kongo
M'banza-Kongo.summary: M'banza-Kongo is a city of 175,000 in Northern Angola, near the border with the Democratic Republic of Congo.
M'banza-Kongo.description: capital of Angola's northwestern Zaire Province

Bechar.title: Bechar
Bechar.summary: Bechar is a city in Algeria's Saharan Atlas region.
Bechar.description: Small city in the Sahara, not far from the Moroccan border.

Oran.title: Oran
Oran.summary: Oran is a city of more than 600,000 people in Northwest Algeria.
Oran.description: Algeria's 2nd largest city after Algiers, also called "second Paris" by Algerians, with many impressive buildings from colonial times.

Constantine.title: Constantine
Constantine.summary: Constantine is a city in Northeast Algeria.
Constantine.description: Algeria's 3rd largest city with a canyon going down through it.

Tamanrasset.title: Tamanrasset
Tamanrasset.summary: Tamanrasset is a city deep in Saharan Algeria.
Tamanrasset.description: Largest town in the south and starting point for expeditions to the Sahara and the Hoggar Mountains.

Sétif.title: Sétif
Sétif.summary: Sétif is a city in Northeast Algeria.
Sétif.description: The trade capital of Algeria, Setif El- Ali (The High) is the capital of high plateaus, with quite moderate temperatures and occasional snow falls in the winter.

M'zab.title: M'zab
M'zab.summary: M'zab is a limestone plateau in Saharan Algeria and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its collection of desert fortress-cities is exotic to the point of surrealism.

Encamp.title: Encamp
Encamp.summary: Encamp is a parish (administrative division) and town 4 km NE of the capital of Andorra between Andorra La Vella and the French border at Pas de la Casa (2085 m).
Encamp.description: parish to the NE of Andorra La Vella between Engordany and Canillo on the road to France

Alaverdi.title: Alaverdi
Alaverdi.summary: Alaverdi (Armenian: Ալավերդի) is a city in Northern Armenia, and an important commercial and industrial centre in this region.
Alaverdi.description: home of  UNESCO World Heritage site Sanahin Monastery and nearby Haghpat Monastery

Dilijan.title: Dilijan
Dilijan.summary: Dilijan is a town with mild climate and fresh air to the northeast of Yerevan. It is famous for its lovely surroundings, called the "Armenian Switzerland" by the locals, due to the densely forested valleys and mountains with alpine meadows surrounding them. It is an excellent base for hiking.
Dilijan.description: popular forest resort known as the "Little Switzerland" of Armenia.

Echmiadzin.title: Echmiadzin
Echmiadzin.summary: Echmiadzin (renamed Vagharshapat in 1992), in Central Armenia, is Armenia's fourth-largest city. It is the seat of the Armenian Catholicos, head of the Armenian Apostolic Church, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It's usually visited as a day-trip from Yerevan, along with nearby Zvartnots.
Echmiadzin.description: the spiritual capital of Armenia, home to the Armenian Catholicos, is a  UNESCO World Heritage site

Yerevan.title: Yerevan
Yerevan.summary: Yerevan (Armenian: Երեւան) is the capital of the Republic of Armenia, one of the three hubs of the South Caucasus and is home to over a million people - the largest Armenian community in the world. In Soviet years Yerevan underwent massive reconstruction, following architect Alexander Tamanyan's plan to make a "perfect city" - a Neo-Classical town with wide avenues, resembling Paris, Vienna and Saint Petersburg.
sights: Saint Gregory the Illuminator Cathedral, Yerevan
Saint John the Baptist Church, Yerevan
Yerevan.description: the capital, and by far the largest city

Gyumri.title: Gyumri
Gyumri.summary: Gyumri is the second largest city in Armenia and the capital of Shirak Province in Northern Armenia.
Gyumri.description: Armenia's 2nd largest city which once dwarfed Yerevan. Small old town area still shows earthquake damage from 1988.

Jermuk.title: Jermuk
Jermuk.summary: Jermuk is a spa town in Southern Armenia, where much of the country's mineral water comes from. The town is full of Soviet hotels and sanatoriums, some of which have been renovated to high standards. The countryside at this very high elevation resort is worth the visit as well, with canyons, forest and wildlife to explore.
Jermuk.description: famous for its mineral waters, which come out at very high temperature and can be enjoyed at the spas. Ski lifts are under construction.

Tsaghkadzor.title: Tsaghkadzor
Tsaghkadzor.summary: Tsaghkadzor is a city in Central Armenia, known for being a ski resort, with forests and an ancient monastery.  In the summer, people go there to get away from the city life of Yerevan, and the heat, for the fresh air in the mountains.  In the winter, the town is completely overtaken by skiers and people who just want to relax and enjoy the snow and scenery.

Vanadzor.title: Vanadzor
Vanadzor.summary: Vanadzor (Armenian: Վանաձոր) is capital of Lori Marz, in the North Central part of Armenia. Vanadzor is Armenia's third largest city, with a population of about 105,000 people.  There are a few old churches, however big part of the city has been built during the time of the Soviet Union with a grand central square, a humongous old Soviet chemical factory which has been idle for decades, and a river running through the somewhat narrow valley, surrounded by hills.
sights: Church of the Holy Mother of God, Vanadzor
Vanadzor.description: Armenia's 3rd largest city with a few nice churches

Canberra.title: Canberra
Canberra.summary: Canberra is the purpose built capital city of Australia, located in the Australian Capital Territory in the south-east of New South Wales. A planned city with national monuments, museums, and galleries all built around large man-made lakes. The bush capital - Canberra is also a great place to enjoy the outdoors, with excellent cycling, gardens, parks, bushwalking and nature reserves.
Canberra.description: the relatively small, purpose-built national capital of Australia is home to plenty of museums

Andorra la Vella.title: Andorra la Vella
Andorra la Vella.summary: Andorra la Vella is the capital of Andorra. At an altitude of 1023 m it is Europe's highest capital, and the only one located over 1 km above the sea level.

Cabinda (city).title: Cabinda (city)
Cabinda (city).summary: Cabinda City a city of 400,000 and the capital of Cabinda region of Angola.
Cabinda (city).description: the wealthy capital of oil-rich Cabinda Province

Saint John's.title: Saint John's
Saint John's.summary: Saint John's is the capital city of Antigua and Barbuda. It is on the island of Antigua.
Saint John's.description: Capital, on the island of Antigua

Great Escarpment (Angola).title: Great Escarpment (Angola)
Great Escarpment (Angola).summary: The Angolan section of Southern Africa's Great Escarpment is in Southwest Angola.
Great Escarpment (Angola).description: the steepest mountains of Angola, with scenic drives (4x4 only), opportunities for adventurous hikers, and some spectacular views, most notably the Tundavala Gap.

English Harbour.title: English Harbour
English Harbour.summary: English Harbour is a town in southern Antigua.

Buenos Aires.title: Buenos Aires
Buenos Aires.summary: Buenos Aires is the capital of Argentina.
Buenos Aires.description: or "Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires", which people occasionally call Capital Federal to distinguish it from the province of Buenos Aires

Córdoba (city, Argentina).title: Córdoba (city, Argentina)
Córdoba (city, Argentina).summary: Córdoba is the second largest city in Argentina, with about 1.4 million inhabitants, and is the capital of Cordoba province. It is known for its rich colonial heritage and its old university, now the second-largest of the country. You can’t miss the historical centre and the magnificent churches, the Cathedral and the Jesuitic quarter with the Montserrat School and the old University buildings. Also, Córdoba is home to the perhaps most popular Argentine Latin pop music genre, cuarteto.
Córdoba (city, Argentina).description: second largest city, in the heart of the Pampas region

La Plata.title: La Plata
La Plata.summary: La Plata is the capital city of Buenos Aires Province, Argentina. It is placed on the "pampa húmeda" (wet pampas), 56 km south-east of Buenos Aires city, at 34º 55' south latitude and 57º 17' west longitude.
La Plata.description: known as "the perfect city" for its tracing; just look at a map of the street pattern of the city

San Juan (city, Argentina).title: San Juan (city, Argentina)
San Juan (city, Argentina).summary: San Juan is the capital city of San Juan province, in the central-west Cuyo region of Argentina, about 150 km north of Mendoza.
San Juan (city, Argentina).description: a centre of quality wine production

San Carlos de Bariloche.title: San Carlos de Bariloche
San Carlos de Bariloche.summary: Bariloche is in the Río Negro Province, near the Nahuel Huapi National Park in Argentina.
San Carlos de Bariloche.description: in the foothills of the Andes with lots of facilities for skiing and trekking. Known for its picturesque snow-covered landscapes and the European style of its buildings

El Calafate.title: El Calafate
El Calafate.summary: El Calafate is a small town in the Patagonia region of Argentina.
El Calafate.description: the main destination when visiting the Glaciers National Park; advancing to the Perito Moreno Glacier is a must when visiting Argentina

Nahuel Huapi National Park.title: Nahuel Huapi National Park
Nahuel Huapi National Park.summary: Nahuel Huapi National Park is in the provinces of Neuquen and Rio Negro, in Patagonia, in the foothills of the Andes mountains.
Nahuel Huapi National Park.description: at the foothills of the Andes mountains with lakes, rivers, waterfalls, peaks, glaciers and forests

Durrës.title: Durrës
Durrës.summary: Durrës is an Albanian Adriatic port city. It has ferries to Bari in (Italy). Alternative spellings of the city's name are Durazzo (Italian),  Drač (Драч, Serbo-Croatian) or Dyrrhachion (Δυρράχιον, Greek).

Iguaçu Falls.title: Iguaçu Falls
Iguaçu Falls.summary: One of the great natural wonders of the world, the Iguaçu Falls (Portuguese: Cataratas do Iguaçu, Spanish: Cataratas del Iguazú, Tupi: Y Ûasu "big water") are close to the triple border of Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. The area is on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Iguazú National Park is on the Argentinian side of the falls, and Iguaçu National Park is on the Brazilian side.

links.text: Foz do Iguaçu city web site

Thethi.title: Thethi
Thethi.summary: Thethi is a village surrounded by Thethi National Park, up on Albanian Alps, in Northeastern Albania, in Shkodra District.

Abacos.title: Abacos
Abacos.summary: The Abacos are a group of islands in the Bahamas east of Grand Bahama.  Great Abaco and Little Abaco are the primary islands.  Disney's privately-owned "Castaway Cay" is here.
Abacos.description: group of islands in the Bahamas

New Providence.title: New Providence
New Providence.summary: New Providence Island is, by far, the most populated island in the Bahamas and the site of the capital Nassau.

Barisal.title: Barisal
Barisal.summary: Barisal is the capital of Barisal Division in southern Bangladesh.
Barisal.description: Southern city famous for growing paddy, floating markets and many rivers, best reached by a slow-paced and relaxing boat ride on the Rocket Steamer.

Qabala.title: Qabala
Qabala.summary: Qabala is a city in Azerbaijan's Sheki Region.
Qabala.description: A new resort town deep in Caucasian Montains, which has taken its name given from the archaeological site about 20 km southwest.

Pinswang.title: Pinswang
Pinswang.summary: Pinswang is a picturesque historic Alpine village in the Austrian Ausserfern region of the northern Tirol. It lies on the border with the Allgäu region of Bavaria Germany.
Pinswang.description: one of the most ancient settlements of the North Tyrolean Ausserfern, on the border with Bavaria and a short walk or drive to the famous castles of King Ludwig

Jessore.title: Jessore
Jessore.summary: Jessore (pronounced Josh-ore) is a city in the Khulna Division of Bangladesh. There's not a lot to do here, but the people are friendly and it makes an OK stopover en route to or from Rajshahi, Khulna or Benapole.
Jessore.description: A small town famous for Gur which is a form of cake-like molasses produced from the extract of date trees.

Rangpur (Bangladesh).title: Rangpur (Bangladesh)
Rangpur (Bangladesh).description: Important city in the north-west, with agriculture and trade.

Lahich.title: Lahich
Lahich.summary: Lahich (Lahıc, Lahij) is a mountain village in the Sheki Region.
Lahich.description: A cozy and remote highland village, and potential "base camp" for tracks to Quba through the Caucasus Mountains.

Mir.title: Mir
Mir.summary: Mir is a town in the Kareličy region of Grodno Oblast in Belarus. Prior to the 2nd World War it was known as an international centre of Jewish learning (Mir yeshiva).
Mir.description: (Мірскі замак, Mirski zamak) — another  UNESCO World Heritage site

Kaprun.title: Kaprun
Kaprun.summary: Kaprun is a town in the Zell am See district of Salzburg, Austria.
Kaprun.description: part of the Europa Sport Region

Gomel.title: Gomel
Gomel.summary: Gomel (Belarusian/Russian: Го́мель; also transliterated as Homel) is the second largest city in Belarus (around 500 000 inhabitants), and is the capital of Gomel Oblast.
Gomel.description: (Гомель) — also called Homel, is the second largest city in Belarus; located in the east.

Exuma.title: Exuma
Exuma.summary: Exuma is a district of the Bahamas, consisting of over 360 islands (or cays). The largest of the cays, and the only one with any significant population, is Great Exuma, which is 37 mi (60 km) in length.

Baku Region.title: Baku Region
Baku Region.summary: Baku Region is a region in Azerbaijan, which includes the Absheron, Agsu, Baku, Haciqabul, Khyzy, Qobustan, and Shamakhi rayons.
Baku Region.description: and Northeastern Azerbaijan. This region is home to the top-rated beaches and luxury resorts of the Caspian coast.

Khulna.title: Khulna
Khulna.summary: Khulna is the main city in Khulna Division in Bangladesh. On the bank of Rupsha (and Bhairav) river, it is known as the industrial city and located in southern part of Bangladesh. A large part of the Sundarbans, a UNESCO world heritage is located in Khulna. It has many Jute mills, the only newsprint mill and hardboard mill of Bangladesh, the only state-owned match factory (Dada match, later Dhaka match), Oxygen company (BOL), Ship yard. Khulna is the 4th largest city in Bangladesh after Dhaka,Chittagong and Comilla. It is a quiet, calm city inhabited by 1.5 million people.
Khulna.description: Located on the Rupsha river, famous for shrimp and a starting point for journeys into the Sundarbans.

Nesvizh.title: Nesvizh
Nesvizh.summary: Nesvizh (Niasviž) is a city in Minsk Province, Belarus.
Nesvizh.description: (Нясві́ж, Njasvizh or Nyasvizh) — with a UNESCO listed castle.

Quba.title: Quba
Quba.summary: Quba (or Guba) is a city in Northeastern Azerbaijan, on the northern slope of the Caucasus, 180 km northwest of Baku.
Quba.description: Its urban suburb is home to the largest Azerbaijani Jewish community in the mountains and is considered one of the largest Jewish communities in the former Soviet Union.

Andros (Bahamas).title: Andros (Bahamas)
Andros (Bahamas).summary: Andros is an archipelago of the Bahamas, split into three main islands: North Andros, Mangrove Cay and South Andros.

Grand Bahama.title: Grand Bahama
Grand Bahama.summary: Grand Bahama Island is an island of the Bahamas.

Qax.title: Qax
Qax.summary: Qax, Qakh, also Kakhi (კახი) or sometimes Gakh is a town in Azerbaijan's Qakh Region. It is at the foot of the southern slope of the Greater Caucasus, on the river Kurhumchai.
Qax.description: A gateway into the Caucasian Mountains besides Sheki, and "base camp" for treks towards Sarıbaş and into the Alazan Valley .

Khinalug.title: Khinalug
Khinalug.summary: Khinalug the highest (2250 m above sea level), most remote and isolated village in Northeastern Azerbaijan and among the highest in the Caucasus.
Khinalug.description: (Xinaliq) — A scenic, remote and ancient mountain village, and the mountain of the same name nearby. Once a centre of Zoroastrianism; today the few inhabitants are an ethnic isolate believed to be descendants of the Caucasus Albanians (unrelated to modern-day Albanians of Albania).

Eng.title: Eng
Eng.summary: Eng is the largest alm settlement of Europe, in the Austrian alpine region North Tyrol. An alm is a seasonally used grazing ground at high altitude.
Eng.description: the largest alm in Europe and one of the most remote settlements in the Alps

Rajshahi.title: Rajshahi
Rajshahi.summary: Rajshahi is the capital of Rajshahi Division in Bangladesh.

Eisenstadt.title: Eisenstadt
Eisenstadt.summary:
Eisenstadt  is the state capital of Burgenland in Austria. It consists of 4 districts: Kleinhöflein im Burgenland, Eisenstadt-Oberberg, Eisenstadt-Unterberg and St. Georgen am Leithagebirge.
Kleinhöflein is the most western part of Eisenstadt, St. Georgen am Leithagebirge the most eastern one. Both are known for their vintners and the many Heurigen. Eisenstadt-Oberberg is popular for the Bergkirche or Haydnkirche, which houses the Haydnmausoleum while Eisenstadt-Unterberg is characterized by the former Jewish district.
Eisenstadt.description: historically the seat of the Eszterházy Hungarian noble family that gave the town its aristocratic feel

Cox's Bazar.title: Cox's Bazar
Cox's Bazar.summary: Cox's Bazar is a beach resort in the Chittagong Division in south-eastern Bangladesh. It has one of the longest sea beaches in the world, 120 km (75 miles) long.
Cox's Bazar.description: The country's premier beach destination, filled to the brim with boisterous Bangladeshi holiday makers and street vendors (hawkers). It is the world's longest natural coastline with 112 km (70 mi) of pristine unbroken sandy beach.

Zell am See.title: Zell am See
Zell am See.summary: Zell am See is an alpine city in the Zell Valley in Salzburg, Austria, and the capital of its own administrative district. Its name refers to the 68 m deep lake (See in German) with which it shares the valley. Zell am See is an important tourist hub owing to its airport, and makes up the majority of the Zell am See-Kaprun ski area.
Zell am See.description: one of the most important alpine tourist towns in Austria

Paradise Island.title: Paradise Island
Paradise Island.summary: Paradise Island is a small island just off of Nassau, Bahamas.  It is dominated by the Las Vegas-style Atlantis resort, which is responsible for an amazing 11% of the Bahamas' GNP.
Paradise Island.description: a resort island in the Bahamas' capital city of Nassau

Grimbergen.title: Grimbergen
Grimbergen.summary: Grimbergen is a town of 37,000 inhabitants in Flemish Brabant, Belgium, just north of Brussels. The town is known for its abbey, castles and abbey beer.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Grimbergen.description: known for the beer with the same name, risen to worldwide fame, but still produced in its abbey.

Dinant.title: Dinant
Dinant.summary: Dinant is a relatively small but very picturesque city in the province of Namur in Belgium. It stretches along the river Meuse against the steep rock face behind on the eastern side, with a thinner strip on the western side against a forest. Its old town is perhaps one the most impressive sights in Wallonia, but the locality is relatively remote. The main sights are all close to each other and not very numerous, while accommodation opportunities are scarce, so Dinant is probably a good option for a nice day trip from larger Belgian cities such as Brussels, Charleroi or Liège. It also can serve as the starting point for a more thorough exploration of the Ardennes.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Dinant.description: small city in a stunning natural setting, a popular spot for adventure sports such as canoeing and rock-climbing, best visited in winter

Mons.title: Mons
Mons.summary: Mons (Dutch: Bergen, not to be confused with the namesake city in Norway) is the capital of the Belgian province of Hainaut, in the region of Wallonia. The town is a worthy place to base yourself for a multi-day exploration of the Hainaut region.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Mons.description: has had the extraordinary privilege of having two sites inscribed on the  UNESCO World Heritage site List and one event on the Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

Tervuren.title: Tervuren
Tervuren.summary: Tervuren is a municipality in Flemish Brabant on the outskirts of the vast Sonian Forest, south-west of Brussels. It is best known as the host town of the Belgian king's summer residence, which is now the Museum for Central Africa, and for the beautiful park surrounding it.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Tervuren.description: known for its proximity to the lush Sonian Forest, its parks, and royal summer residence.

Saint Martins Island.title: Saint Martins Island
Saint Martins Island.summary: Saint Martins Island is in the Chittagong Division of Bangladesh and lies about 10 km south-west of the southern tip of the mainland.
Saint Martins Island.description: The country's main coral island with friendly locals, a laid back vibe and coconuts to spare.

Sheki.title: Sheki
Sheki.summary: Sheki (azr. Şəki, pronounced as Shaki or as locals say Shachi) is Azerbaijan's true travel gem, a small city off on the forested slopes of the Greater Caucasus Mountains. Rich in Islamic architecture, Silk Road history, good food, and friendly people, this is travel and leisure in the Caucasus at its finest.
Sheki.description: A beautiful city in the forested Caucasus Mountains with lots to see and do. It has one of the largest densities of cultural resources and monuments that span 2,700 years of Azerbaijani history.

Perth.title: Perth
Perth.summary: Perth is the capital and largest city of Western Australia. It is  separated from Adelaide (the nearest city with over one million inhabitants) by a distance of 2,139 km, including the vast spaces of the Nullarbor Plain.
Perth.description: the most remote continental city on Earth, on the south-western edge of Western Australia

Villach.title: Villach
Villach.summary: Villach is a town  in the Carinthia province of Austria. It has about 60,000 inhabitants.
Villach.description: beautiful Altstadt surrounded by the Alps and various lakes

Klagenfurt.title: Klagenfurt
Klagenfurt.summary: Klagenfurt (Slovenian: Celovec) is the capital of Carinthia in Austria. It was one of the eight host cities in the 2008 European Football Championships.
Klagenfurt.description: scenic town very close to the Wörthersee

Namur.title: Namur
Namur.summary: Namur is the capital of Wallonia, the French-speaking southern part of Belgium. Namur is also the capital of the province with the same name, Namur. The city is inhabited by about 110,000 inhabitants.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Namur.description: capital of Wallonia, at the confluence of Sambre and Meuse with the Citadel.

Bimini.title: Bimini
Bimini.summary: Bimini is a district of the Bahamas and consists of two main islands located 50 miles east of Florida.

Kakadu National Park.title: Kakadu National Park
Kakadu National Park.summary: Kakadu National Park is in the Northern Territory of Australia, 171 km east of Darwin. The national park is inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage list.
Kakadu National Park.description: outback adventure travel, aboriginal culture and nature activities in the Northern Territory

Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park.title: Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park
Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park.summary: Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park is a park in the southern portion of the Northern Territory of Australia, part of the so-called Red Centre of the continent. The National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage area. It is best known for Uluru (also known as Ayers Rock), a single massive rock formation, and also for Kata Tjuta (also known as "The Olgas"), a range of rock domes.
Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park.description: Uluru (also known as Ayers Rock) and Kata Tjuta (The Olgas) are iconic rock formations in the "Red Centre" in the middle of the Australian desert

Katherine.title: Katherine
Katherine.summary: Katherine is a village in the Lower Top End of the Northern Territory, Australia.
Katherine.description: includes the amazing Katherine Gorge, close to the town of Katherine

Grodno.title: Grodno
Grodno.summary: Grodno  (Belarusian: Hrodna, Russian: Grodno) is a city in Belarus, on the Neman River, close to the borders of Poland and Lithuania (about 20 km and 30 km away respectively).
Grodno.description: (Гродна, Hrodna) — city close to the Polish and Lithuanian borders.

Mechelen.title: Mechelen
Mechelen.summary: Mechelen is a historically important city located on the river Dyle in the center of Flanders, one of the three regions in Belgium. It lies about halfway between Antwerp and Brussels and has approximately 80,000 inhabitants.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Mechelen.description: a small medieval city with a nice historic district around the cathedral.

Igls.title: Igls
Igls.summary: Igls is an alpine town in the Inn Valley just south of Innsbruck in North Tyrol, Austria.
Igls.description: a popular ski resort in the shadow of the Patscherkofel mountain near Innsbruck

Brest (Belarus).title: Brest (Belarus)
Brest (Belarus).summary: Brest is a border town in the south-west corner of Belarus, near Terespol in Poland.

Nassau.title: Nassau
Nassau.summary: Nassau is the capital of The Bahamas.  It is the largest city in the Bahamas and its low-rise sprawl dominates the eastern half of New Providence Island.
sights: Ardastra Gardens, Zoo and Conservation Centre
National Art Gallery of The Bahamas
Nassau.description: capital city of the Commonwealth of the Bahamas

Dhaka.title: Dhaka
Dhaka.summary: Dhaka (formerly Dacca in English) is the capital and largest city of Bangladesh. It is the largest city by population in the historical region of Bengal and a major city in South Asia. Dhaka emerged as a cosmopolitan city during the Mughal Empire. It is a hub for trade and culture, with a long history as a Bengali capital. It has been called the City of Mosques and the Venice of the East, due to its Islamic architecture and a riverfront facing the Buriganga (Old Ganges). It is also known as the Rickshaw Capital of the World, as there are over 500,000 cycle rickshaws running on its roads. Although it is described as a concrete jungle, Dhaka has venerable green spaces, including many gardens and parks. Today, Dhaka is South Asia's second most populous capital after Delhi and an important financial center alongside Mumbai and Karachi.
Dhaka.description: The hectic capital city, an intense and thriving metropolis of around 12 million people that's growing by the day. Also known as the rickshaw capital of the world, it is one of the world’s largest capital cities and most densely populated.

Ganja.title: Ganja
Ganja.summary: Ganja (Azeri: Gəncə) is a city in the Ganja Region of northwestern Azerbaijan.
Ganja.description: Azerbaijan's second largest city has a long history, some important sites and an interesting and manifold architecture.

Hawar Islands.title: Hawar Islands
Hawar Islands.summary: The Hawar Islands are in Bahrain, southeast of the main island near Qatar.
Hawar Islands.description: (جزر حوار‎ , Juzur Ḩawār) – just off the coast of Qatar, these islands are very popular with birdwatchers.

Darwin.title: Darwin
Darwin.summary: Darwin, a small yet cosmopolitan city, is the tropical capital city of the Northern Territory. People from more than 50 nations make up its population of 110,000. It is located on the Northern Territory coast (in north-central Australia), with the Timor Sea (a branch of the Indian Ocean) to the west, and the Arafura Sea to the north in Indonesian waters.
Darwin.description: Australia's tropical northern capital, at the top end of the Northern Territory

Sylhet.title: Sylhet
Sylhet.summary: Sylhet is the capital of Sylhet Division in Bangladesh.
Sylhet.description: The largest city in the northeast, known for the shrine of Sufi saint Hazrat Shahjalal, one of the holiest sites in the country.

Bregenz.title: Bregenz
Bregenz.summary: Bregenz is the capital of Vorarlberg in Austria at the Lake Constance.
Bregenz.description: famous for the annual summer music festival of Bregenzer Festspiele

Liège.title: Liège
Liège.summary: Liège (German: Lüttich, Dutch: Luik) is the largest city of Wallonia, the French-speaking part of Belgium, and the capital city of the namesake province.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Liège.description: second largest city of Wallonia, along a wide river, industrial cityscape with hiking and resorts in the nearby hills, it has a very strong, independent character and an exciting night-life.

Naftalan.title: Naftalan
Naftalan.description: A well-known petroleum spa resort, the centre of medical tourism in Azerbaijan.

Mayaguana.title: Mayaguana
Mayaguana.summary: Mayaguana (pronounced May-guana) is the most southeasterly, least developed, and most unspoiled of the Bahamas' inhabited islands. It is 27 miles long and 6 miles wide at its widest. The population is 300.

Sundarbans.title: Sundarbans
Sundarbans.summary: The Sundarbans is a huge mangrove forest on the coast of the Ganges delta by the Bay of Bengal. 60% of the forest lies in southwestern Bangladesh; the remaining 40% in West Bengal, India. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and famous as a sanctuary of the Bengal tiger.
Sundarbans.description: The largest mangrove forest in the world, with lots of bird life and the home of the very elusive but endangered Royal Bengal Tigers.

Qobustan.title: Qobustan
Qobustan.summary: Qobustan is a city in Azerbaijan's Baku Region.
Qobustan.description: Best known for its rock petroglyphs (a UNESCO World Heritage site) and mud volcanoes. Mud volcano wise, a better option might be the free site a little further south, see Baku Region.

Mymensingh.title: Mymensingh
Mymensingh.summary: Mymensingh is a city in Bangladesh with renowned educational institutes, Brahmaputra River, and the beauty of green paddy fields.
Mymensingh.description: A historic city located by the side of river Brahmaputa. It has got a rich cultural and political history dating back more than 200 years.

Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park.title: Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park
Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park.summary: Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park (Belarusian: Белавежская пушча) is in the Brest and Hrodna regions of Belarus.
Belovezhskaya Pushcha National Park.description: (Нацыянальны парк Белавежская пушча, Natsyyanal’ny park Byelavyezhskaya pushcha) — on the border with Poland, this primeval forest is a  UNESCO World Heritage site

Bagerhat.title: Bagerhat
Bagerhat.summary: Bagerhat Sadar Upazila is a world heritage listed historical town in the Khulna Division of Bangladesh.
Bagerhat.description: An important historical centre and site of several historic mosques including the famous Shait Gumbad Masjid (Sixty Domed Mosque).

Watarrka National Park.title: Watarrka National Park
Watarrka National Park.summary: Watarrka National Park is in the Northern Territory, Australia; its main attraction is King's Canyon.
Watarrka National Park.description: most famous for Kings Canyon, a mighty chasm reaching a depth of 270 metres

Manama.title: Manama
Manama.summary: Manama (Arabic: المنامة, transliteration: al-Manāma) is the capital and largest city of Bahrain with an approximate population of 157,000 people, roughly a quarter of the country's population.

Polotsk.title: Polotsk
Polotsk.summary: Polotsk (or Polatsk)  is a city in Belarus, in Vitebsk Oblast. First mentioned in 862, it is the oldest city in Belarus. Now it is a city of local importance with 82,000 inhabitants and with considerable architectural heritage from the times of old Rus as well as from the later periods.
Polotsk.description: (По́лацк, Połack) — the oldest Belarusian city, notable for interesting buildings.

Cairns.title: Cairns
Cairns.summary: Cairns is touted as the "gateway to the Great Barrier Reef" and other destinations such as Kuranda and the Daintree rainforest in Far North Queensland, Australia, although the city has little to offer to travellers besides tour agencies, a handful of restaurants, cafes, and backpacker bars, and a long walk along the esplanade looking out at the swampy shoreline. Its 150,000 residents are regularly outnumbered by domestic and international visitors.
Cairns.description: gateway to the Great Barrier Reef, Port Douglas, Daintree National Park, and many beautiful beaches and resorts; a great place for people to get away and relax

Graz.title: Graz
Graz.summary: Graz is the capital of Styria (Steiermark) and the second largest city of Austria with a population of just below 300,000 - about 40,000 of which are students of its six universities. It has been a vital urban centre for both Styria, Austria and Slovenia, and has produced a number of talents in many fields, ranging from the inventor Nikola Tesla to the governor of California, Arnold Schwarzenegger.
Graz.description: known as Austria's culinary capital and student city

Linz.title: Linz
Linz.summary: Linz is the third largest city in Austria with 203,000 inhabitants, on the Danube (Donau) river, and the capital of the federal province of Upper Austria (Oberösterreich) and forms the heart of Austria's second strongest economic region. Linz is primarily known as a major industrial centre but also has a very picturesque historical old town including Austria's largest central square, surrounded by an impressive ensemble of Baroque architecture. In the recent past, Linz has tried to reposition itself as a cultural hub with numerous new museums and events. The tourist slogan of the city is "In Linz beginnt's" ("It starts in Linz").
Linz.description: a vibrant music and arts scene and a beautiful historic core

Bruges.title: Bruges
Bruges.summary: Bruges (Dutch: Brugge) is a picturesque city in Flanders, the northern part of Belgium. Once Europe's richest city, now both cosmopolitan and bourgeois in its compact size, it is one of the best preserved pre-motorised cities in Europe and offers the kind of charms rarely available other than in Europe.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Bruges.description: one of Europe's wealthiest cities in the 14th century, it is touristy yet still very authentic, medieval and quiet at night, with small guest houses and family businesses greatly outnumbering chain hotels.

Ghent.title: Ghent
Ghent.summary: Ghent (Dutch: Gent, French: Gand) is a city in East Flanders in Belgium. Ghent is a city with a population of a quarter of a million, with rich history. At the same time, Ghent has a relatively high share of young people, and a significant seasonal student population.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Ghent.description: once one of Europe's largest cities, now a perfect mixture of Antwerp and Bruges: a cosy city with canals, yet with rich history and lively student population.

Melbourne.title: Melbourne
Melbourne.summary: Melbourne is the second largest city and the cultural capital of Australia, with Victorian-era architecture, extensive shopping, museums, galleries, theatres, and large parks and gardens.  Many of its 5 million residents are both multicultural and sports-mad. The capital of the south-eastern state of Victoria, and located at the head of Port Phillip Bay, Melbourne is a magnet for migrants from all over the world, and consistently ranks as one of the world's most liveable cities.
Melbourne.description: Australia's second largest city, Melbourne is the country's sporting, shopping, food and cultural capital, while also being regarded as Australia's most European city

Eleuthera.title: Eleuthera
Eleuthera.summary: Eleuthera is an island in Bahamas.

Antwerp.title: Antwerp
Antwerp.summary: Antwerp (Dutch: Antwerpen, French: Anvers) is a large city and the capital of the eponymous province in the region of Flanders in Belgium. At a population of just over half a million people, it is the second largest city in Belgium (after Brussels), and it has a major European port. Due to its long and culturally rich history, the city of Antwerp houses many interesting historical buildings from different historical periods, as well as a lot of interesting museums. Antwerp is also known as the global diamond trade hub - more than 70% of all diamonds are traded in Antwerp.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Antwerp.description: Belgium's second largest city, with a giant cathedral, medieval streets and artistic heritage, and a great place for fashion.

Mogilev.title: Mogilev
Mogilev.summary: Mogilev is a city in Mogilev Oblast.
sights: Co-Cathedral of the Assumption of the Virgin and St. Stanislaus, Mogilev
Mogilev.description: (Магілёў) — also called Mahiljou and Mahilyow, third largest city in Belarus.

Hobart.title: Hobart
Hobart.summary: Hobart is the capital city of the Australian state of Tasmania and is Australia's second oldest city, after Sydney. Hobart sits along the Derwent River and began humbly as a penal colony. Hobart is now a small and intimate city with a population of around 220,000 in the Greater Hobart area. The city is renowned for its many historic buildings, including the famous Salamanca Place, and is the gateway to Southern Tasmania.  Hobart played a major role during the heroic age of Antarctic exploration and is one of the five gateway cities to Antarctica.
Hobart.description: picturesque and quiet capital of Tasmania, the site of the second convict settlement in Australia

Muharraq.title: Muharraq
Muharraq.summary: Muharraq is a metropolitan area in Bahrain, an island connected to the northeast of the capital of Manama.

Spa (Belgium).title: Spa (Belgium)
Spa (Belgium).summary: Spa is a town in the Liège province in Belgium, known as the "original" spa, i.e. a place where tourists came in to enjoy the health and wellness benefits of water and hot springs in particular. The springs in Spa became so popular that the name became genericized to mean any such place, with other versions of how it came to be also created over the years. Apart from the mineral waters, Spa also draws crowds several times a year when racing and other events are held at the nearby Spa-Francorchamps track.
Spa (Belgium).description: the hot water treatments of the spa town that gave its name to all spas in the world has drawn visitors for centuries.

Lankaran.title: Lankaran
Lankaran.summary: Lankaran, Lenkeran, or Lenkoran is in Azerbaijan's Talysh Region.
Lankaran.description: Southern city near the Iranian border.

Minsk.title: Minsk
Minsk.summary: Minsk (Belarusian: Мінск, Russian: Минск)  is the capital and largest city of the Republic of Belarus, its population is about two million people.
sights: Church of Saints Simon and Helena
State Security Committee of the Republic of Belarus
National Opera and Ballet of Belarus
Minsk.description: (Belarusian Cyrillic: Мінск) — the Belarusian capital and largest city, with over 2 million inhabitants.

Innsbruck.title: Innsbruck
Innsbruck.summary: Innsbruck is the fifth-largest city in Austria and the provincial capital of Tyrol, as well as one of the largest cities in the Alps. It is in a valley of the river Inn between mountain ranges of above 2000 m above sea level, halfway between Bavaria and northern Italy, and is a hub of a region popular for skiing and other mountain-related activities and a busy tourist destination. Its popularity as a winter sports resort was underscored by its hosting the Winter Olympic Games twice.
sights: Botanical Garden of the University of Innsbruck
Innsbruck.description: the cultural and economic centre of Western Austria

Göygöl National Park.title: Göygöl National Park
Göygöl National Park.summary: Göygöl National Park is in Ganja Region of Azerbaijan.
Göygöl National Park.description: About 25 km further afield from Ganja, near Toğanalı. A hiking and leisure destination, whose lake was formed during a strong earthquake in 1139.

Vitebsk.title: Vitebsk
Vitebsk.summary: Vitebsk or Viciebsk (Belarusian: Віцебск, Russian: Витебск) is the middle of Vitebsk Oblast in Belarus.
sights: Old Cathedral of St. Barbara and St. Paul, Vitebsk

Salzburg.title: Salzburg
Salzburg.summary: Salzburg is a city in Austria, near the border with Germany's Bavaria state, with a population of 150,000. It was the setting for the movie The Sound of Music, so you may think you know all there is to see in Salzburg if you have seen the movie. Admittedly, it is difficult not to burst into song when you're walking along the Salzach River, or climbing up to the Hohensalzburg fortress, which looms over the city. But there is a lot more to this compact, courtly city than Julie Andrews and Wolfgang Mozart, who was born here.
Salzburg.description: A city with an attractive setting and scenic Alpine backdrop

Kraainem.title: Kraainem
Kraainem.summary: Kraainem is a municipality on the outskirts of the Brussels Capital Region, administratively belonging to Flemish Brabant. It began as a rural village, but the expansion of Brussels has led to a fast-paced urbanization of Kraainem throughout the 20th century, and the municipality has become a popular residence for Eurocrats and expats alike.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Kraainem.description: a municipality with a rich industrial history on the outskirts of Brussels with many historical landmarks.

Sydney.title: Sydney
Sydney.summary: Sydney is the Harbour City.  It is the largest, oldest and most cosmopolitan city in Australia with an enviable reputation as one of the world's most beautiful and liveable cities.  Brimming with history, nature, culture, art, fashion, cuisine and design, it is set next to miles of ocean coastline and sandy surf beaches. The city is also home to the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge, two of the most iconic structures on the planet.
sights: Art Gallery of New South Wales
State Library of New South Wales
Sydney.description: Australia's oldest and largest city, famous for its picturesque harbour and natural beauty

Leuven.title: Leuven
Leuven.summary: Leuven (French: Louvain) is a flourishing and lively city of about 100,000 inhabitants. It is the capital of the Belgian province of Flemish Brabant. It's a genuine university city which reflects in the streets. During the academic year (end of September until end of June) the city is full of young people, especially on weekdays. Sometimes it may seem that there are no other people living in the city. Summer in Leuven in general is calmer, although a lot of summer events are organised. The university that was founded in 1425 and has more than 40,000 students is the oldest catholic university in the world. The historic centre is one of the most beautiful in Belgium.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Leuven.description: a small city dominated by one of Europe's oldest universities. Beautiful historic centre and a lively nightlife.

Chittagong.title: Chittagong
Chittagong.summary: Chittagong (officially Chattogram) is the main international seaport and second largest city in Bangladesh. Located on the Bay of Bengal, the city is the headquarters of many Bangladeshi companies, including the Chittagong Stock Exchange. According to the British newspaper the Telegraph, Chittagong is one of the ten fastest growing cities in the world.

links.text: Public Bus Fare Chart of Chittagong Metro Area

Chittagong.description: A bustling commercial centre and the second largest international shipping port in the country just after Payra port.

Vienna.title: Vienna
Vienna.summary: Vienna (German: Wien; Austro-Bavarian: Wean) is the capital of the Republic of Austria and by far its most populous city, with an urban population of 1.9 million and a metropolitan population of 2.4 million. It is by far the largest city in Austria and the country's artistic, cultural, economic and political centre. It is known for its high living standards, relaxed yet elegant lifestyle and rich musical life.
Vienna.description: (Wien) — the largest city in Austria, as well as its cultural, economic, and political centre

Adelaide.title: Adelaide
Adelaide.summary: Adelaide is the capital city of South Australia. It lies on the eastern shores of Gulf St Vincent in the central, southern part of the Australian continent. Adelaide is Australia's fifth largest city, with a population of over 1.2 million. More than three quarters of South Australians live in the Adelaide metropolitan area.
Adelaide.description: the "City of Churches", a relaxed South Australian alternative to the big eastern cities

Brussels.title: Brussels
Brussels.summary: Brussels (French: Bruxelles, Dutch: Brussel) is the capital of Belgium and one of the three administrative regions within the country, together with Flanders and Wallonia. Apart from its role within its country, it is also an internationally important city, hosting numerous international institutions, and in particular the core institutions of the European Union. Due to that, it is sometimes referred to informally as the capital of the EU, and even used as a metonym for the EU institutions.
sights: Cathedral of St. Michael and St. Gudula
Basilica of the Sacred Heart, Brussels
Church of Our Lady of Laeken
Brussels.description: Belgium's capital and the unofficial capital of the EU. Nice historic centre and several museums of interest. One of the most multicultural cities in Europe.

Baku.title: Baku
Baku.summary: Baku is the capital of Azerbaijan.
Baku.description: The capital and largest city of the Caucasus.

Brisbane.title: Brisbane
Brisbane.summary: Brisbane is the state capital of Queensland. The Greater Brisbane region has a population of about 2.2 million people, making it the third-largest city in Australia.
Brisbane.description: capital of sun-drenched Queensland and gateway to beautiful sandy beaches

Anjouan.title: Anjouan
Anjouan.summary: Anjouan is an island of Comoros.

Krk.title: Krk
Krk.summary: Krk is a Croatian island in the Adriatic Sea.

Moheli.title: Moheli
Moheli.summary: Moheli is an island in the East African island nation of Comoros.
Moheli.description: autonomous island that forms part of the Union of the Comoros.

Cres.title: Cres
Cres.summary: Cres is a Croatian island in the Adriatic Sea.

Trashigang.title: Trashigang
Trashigang.summary: Trashigang is an administrative town of 4,500 people in Eastern Bhutan. The traditional architecture and narrow streets give the town a quaint and snug feel, not unlike an Italian or Cornish fishing village.
Trashigang.description: (Dzongkha: བཀྲ་ཤིས་སྒང་།) – A picturesque administrative town in the east.

Mayotte.title: Mayotte
Mayotte.summary: Mayotte is a French island in the Indian Ocean off East Africa between Madagascar and Mozambique.
Mayotte.description: overseas department and region of France

Trongsa.title: Trongsa
Trongsa.summary: Trongsa is a town in Bhutan, often known as the gateway to the east of the country.
Trongsa.description: (Dzongkha: ཀྲོང་གསར) – A small administrative town famous for its dzong and the Tower of Trongsa

Chiloé Island.title: Chiloé Island
Chiloé Island.summary: Chiloé Island (Spanish: Isla de Chiloé) is in Southern Chile, off-shore from the northern Patagonian regions of Los Lagos and Aysén.
Chiloé Island.description: the largest island of the country.

Isla del Sol.title: Isla del Sol
Isla del Sol.summary: Isla del Sol ("Island of the Sun") is the largest island on Lake Titicaca, and part of Bolivian territory. An ancient holy site of the Inca, it's easily reachable from Copacabana.
Isla del Sol.description: In the south part of Lake Titicaca. A remote island in the middle of the lake. Astonishing landscapes and very old ruins from Inca period make this location a good place to find peace.

Punakha.title: Punakha
Punakha.summary: Punakha, a former capital of Bhutan, is in the west of the country.
Punakha.description: (Dzongkha: སྤུ་ན་ཁ་) – A former winter capital of Bhutan.Still hosts the Monastic Body in Winter.

Tuzla.title: Tuzla
Tuzla.summary: Tuzla is the third largest city in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in one of the most important industrial Bosnian regions. The city was hardly directly targeted by the war, except for an incident near the end of the war, when 72 people were killed by a shell fired into the Old Town during the evening. Nowadays, the city’s economy is still predominantly based around industry, although there has been significant development in tourism in the 21st century.
Tuzla.description: third largest city with much industry, though has a lovely old town and monuments to the brutal war too

Bokor National Park.title: Bokor National Park
Bokor National Park.summary: Bokor National Park is in Cambodia.

Grand Comore.title: Grand Comore
Grand Comore.summary: Grand Comore is the largest island in the East African island nation of Comoros, and location of the capital.

Pirin National Park.title: Pirin National Park
Pirin National Park.summary: Pirin is in Pirin Macedonia, in Bulgaria. The range is a national park and since 1983 part of the UNESCO World nature heritage.

Amazonas (Brazil).title: Amazonas (Brazil)
Amazonas (Brazil).summary: Amazonas is a state in the North of Brazil. It is the largest state of Brazil in area.
Amazonas (Brazil).description: – jungle tours, wildlife, floated wood, the mysteries of the Amazon

Chacaltaya.title: Chacaltaya
Chacaltaya.summary: Chacaltaya is in the La Paz Department of Bolivia. This mountain, at an altitude of 5486 metres, is equipped with beautiful views and the world's highest ski area. Because of its proximity to La Paz and the easy access, it is a popular place to acclimatize before climbing higher peaks. The ski lift is said to be the oldest in the world and almost never operates.
Chacaltaya.description: & Huayna Potosi — the world's highest ski resort and Bolivia's most popular mountain climb

Chobe National Park.title: Chobe National Park
Chobe National Park.summary: The Chobe National Park, in the north-west of Botswana, near the borders to Zambia, Zimbabwe and Namibia, is famous for its vast variety of wildlife.
Chobe National Park.description: a great place to see wildlife, and a good point from which to move on to Victoria Falls.

Quime.title: Quime
Quime.summary: Quime is a small city in Yungas of Inquisivi region of La Paz.
Quime.description: Raunchy and friendly but sleepy mountain village surrounded by high mountains of the Cordillera Quimsa Cruz, with mines, waterfalls, native cloud forest and 31 Aimara indigenous communities.

Abomey.title: Abomey
Abomey.summary: Abomey is a town and former capital of Benin.
Abomey.description: Royal Palaces are on the UNESCO World Heritage List

Phuentsholing.title: Phuentsholing
Phuentsholing.summary: Phuentsholing (also sometimes spelled Phuntsholing), the second largest town in Bhutan (population around 40,000), is on the Indian border, next to the town of Jaigaon.
Phuentsholing.description: (Dzongkha: ཕུན་ཚོགས་གླིང་) – A town on the Indian border. The point of entry for travelers arriving by bus from Kolkata.

Banlung.title: Banlung
Banlung.summary: Banlung (បានលុង), although a small town, is the capital of Ratanakiri Province in Eastern Cambodia.
Banlung.description: far northeastern provincial capital near some great waterfalls and national parks

Svalbard.title: Svalbard
Svalbard.summary: Svalbard (Russian: Шпицберген, Shpitsbergen or Грумант, Grumant) is a group of islands located between the Arctic Ocean, Barents Sea, Greenland Sea, and the Norwegian Sea. The area is sometimes referred to as Spitsbergen, the main island with all the settlements. The islands are directly north of Norway, and under Norwegian rule since 1920. Svalbard's settlements are the northernmost permanently inhabited spots on the planet, after the Canadian military base at Alert.

Kasane.title: Kasane
Kasane.summary: Kasane is a city in the Okavango-Chobe region, the northeast corner of Botswana.  Set on the south bank of the Chobe River, it faces Namibia's Caprivi Strip to the north. Zimbabwe and Zambia lie nearby. Kasane is a tourist hub, a jumping-off point for the Chobe National Park and Victoria Falls.

Concepción.title: Concepción
Concepción.summary: Concepción is the second largest city of Chile with a population of almost 227,000 (out of Concepción province's 946,000) as of 2016. It is on the coast of Southern Chile.

Porto-Novo.title: Porto-Novo
Porto-Novo.summary: Porto-Novo is the capital of Benin, located on the coast in the southeastern part of the country.
Porto-Novo.description: The capital, if only in name

Chirripo National Park.title: Chirripo National Park
Chirripo National Park.summary: Parque Nacional Chirripó (Chirripó National Park) is a national park in South Pacific Costa Rica accessible by road through the locality of San Isidro de El General in Pérez Zeledo canton.

Læsø.title: Læsø
Læsø.summary: Læsø is the largest island in Kattegat, some 20 kilometres east of Frederikhavn on the Jutland peninsular in Denmark, roughly half way to Gothenburg in Sweden.
Læsø.description: – get away from it all in this remote island in Denmark's "desert belt", ride through the sand dunes on horseback and see unique farmhouses with seaweed roofs.

Douala.title: Douala
Douala.summary: Douala is the largest city and the commercial centre of Cameroon.
Douala.description: the largest city and main centre of trade in Cameroon (French-speaking)

Potosí.title: Potosí
Potosí.summary: Potosí, at around 4,000 metres, is one of the world's highest large cities. It is located in the Potosí Department of Bolivia.
sights: Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of Peace, Potosí
Potosí.description: A high-altitude mining town, once one of the wealthiest cities in the world due to its silver mines. Popular for its mining tours.

Iquique.title: Iquique
Iquique.summary: Iquique is in the Northern Chile. City  home to the duty-free zone called "Zofri" and a growing number of high-rise resort hotels along its beaches. Slightly more expensive and polluted than neighboring population centers, such as Arica, but a convenient place to stock up on duty-free perfumes and laptop computers.

Paro.title: Paro
Paro.summary: Paro (population 4,500) is a town in the south west of Bhutan.
Paro.description: (Dzongkha: སྤ་རོ་) – The location of the international airport and Taktsang Monastery.

Quesada.title: Quesada
Quesada.summary: Ciudad Quesada is a city in the North Zone of Costa Rica. It is the capital city of the canton San Carlos in the province of Alajuela. Although Ciudad Quesada is the official name, it is commonly called San Carlos.
sights: Monteverde and Santa Elena Cloud Forest Reserves
Rincón de la Vieja Volcano National Park
Quesada.description: the largest city by far in the country's North, surrounded by hot springs popular with Costa Rican vacationers; known locally as "San Carlos"

Camagüey.title: Camagüey
Camagüey.summary: Camagüey is a relatively modern capital of Camagüey Province and Cuba's third largest city. Although has some beautiful old churches and colonial buildings, it is not usually considered as a tourist stop. Nevertheless, it is a great city to visit if looking for the "real" Cuban experience.
Camagüey.description: – Cuba's third-largest city is a maze of narrow alleyways, Catholic churches, and jars known as tinajones

Kratie.title: Kratie
