While Florence flourished during the early renaissance, the Golden Age of Dresden was in the 18th century when, under August the Strong and his son, Friedrich August II, Saxony was a rich and important state and the rulers invested in lush architectural projects in their capital and supported artists of worldwide renown.
sights: Hochschule für Musik Carl Maria von Weber
Dresden.description: – Once called Elbflorenz ('Florence on the Elbe'), the Frauenkirche (the finest baroque Cathedral outside Italy, destroyed during the war and rebuilt from 1994 to 2005) and its rebuilt historic Altstadt that was also destroyed during the war. The Zwinger and Residenzschloss museums are unmatched in the world.

Danakil Depression.title: Danakil Depression
Danakil Depression.summary: The Danakil Depression is a desert area in the Afar region of northeastern Ethiopia, north of the Great Rift Valley that is widely known locally as the Dallol depression.
Danakil Depression.description: a salt desert with several volcanoes including the active Erta Ale and the colorful Dallol

Turku.title: Turku
Turku.summary: Turku (Swedish: Åbo) is the oldest city and former capital of Finland. It was settled during the 13th century, making it one of the only few – and by far the largest – medieval cities in Finland. Turku is the cradle of Finnish culture, since over the years it has played an important role as the gateway to Finland for international influence. Nowadays Turku is a vivid city with clusters of maritime and medical business.
Turku.description: the former capital on the western coast. Medieval castle and cathedral.

Frankfurt.title: Frankfurt
Frankfurt.summary: Frankfurt (German: Frankfurt am Main) is the largest city in the German state of Hesse, and is considered  the business and financial centre of Germany. It is the fifth largest city in Germany after Berlin, Hamburg, Munich and Cologne. The city is known for its modern skyline, and for hosting the headquarters of the European Central Bank, the Deutsche Börse stock exchange and numerous German financial services companies. Furthermore, it hosts some of the world's most important trade shows, such as the Frankfurt Auto Show and the Frankfurt Book Fair. Located on the river Main at a crossroad of the German Autobahn system and connected to several  high-speed rail lines, with Germany's busiest airport on its outskirts, Frankfurt is one of the most important transportation hubs of Europe.
sights: St. Paul's Church, Frankfurt am Main
Seat of the European Central Bank
Frankfurt.description: – magnificent skyline, financial and transportation hub of Europe, headquarters of the European Central Bank (ECB) and an important trade fair. Small reconstructed centre with half-timbered houses, important museums and galleries around the Museumsufer like the Schirn Art Hall, the Städel and the Senckenberg Natural Museum.

Patra.title: Patra
Patra.summary: Patras (Modern Greek: Πάτρα, Greek pronunciation: [ˈpatra], Classical Greek and Katharevousa: Πάτραι (pl.)) is the third largest urban conglomeration of Greece, (after Athens/Piraeus and Thessaloniki). It is the capital of the Prefecture of Achaia on the Peloponnese and the western gateway into the country, thanks to numerous ferry connections with Italy.

Rhodes.title: Rhodes
Rhodes.summary: Rhodes (Greek: Ρόδος, Ródos) is one of the largest and most fertile of the Greek Islands, and is one of the most visited because of its combination of beaches, archaeological sites, and extensive medieval town. The climate is particularly good, with the weather typically sunny and mild.  The island is usually counted as one of the Dodecanese, but due to its importance for travelers is considered separately here.
Rhodes.description: (Ρόδος, Ródos) — island with ancient monuments, as well as beaches

Carriacou.title: Carriacou
Carriacou.summary: Carriacou is the second-largest island in the Caribbean nation of Grenada. It is considerably smaller than the island of Grenada, being only 13 square miles.

Dalaba.title: Dalaba
Dalaba.description: a small town often dubbed the "Switzerland of Guinea" because of its relatively mild temperatures and nice scenery.

Gabú.title: Gabú
Gabú.summary: Gabú is a city in Guinea-Bissau.
Gabú.description: Busy market town, with a predominantly Muslim population.

Larissa.title: Larissa
Larissa.summary: Larissa (Greek: Λάρισα), has a population of 162.591 people (2011). It is the 4th largest city in Greece, and is in Thessaly, between Athens (355 km) and Thessaloniki (150 km).  A lively agricultural and university town, it is visited by few tourists.  Nevertheless, its sights and energetic cafe and bar scene make it worth a stop.
Larissa.description: (Λάρισα) — a lively agricultural and university town

Cap-Haïtien.title: Cap-Haïtien
Cap-Haïtien.summary: Cap-Haïtien is the second largest city in Haiti. It lies along a bay on the northern coast of the country.
Cap-Haïtien.description: the country's second biggest city, on the Atlantic coast near some beautiful beaches and interesting old forts.

Semuc Champey.title: Semuc Champey
Semuc Champey.summary: Semuc Champey is a set of crystalline pools over the Río Cahabón in Alta Verapaz, Guatemala. It consists of a natural 300 m limestone bridge, under which passes the Cahabón River.  Atop the bridge is a series of stepped, turquoise pools, a popular swimming attraction. Semuc is part of the backpacker trail in Guatemala.
Semuc Champey.description: It consists of a natural 300 m limestone bridge, under which passes the Cahabón River. Atop the bridge is a series of stepped, turquoise pools, a popular swimming attraction.

Olympia (Greece).title: Olympia (Greece)
Olympia (Greece).summary:
Olympia (Greek: Ολυμπία Olympía) is a town and UNESCO World Heritage Site in Peloponnese, Greece. This was the site of the original Olympic Games from 776 BCE. The games, held every four years in honor of the Greek god Zeus, lasted through the entire Classical Age until the late 4th century CE. The central sanctuary or Altis included temples, altars, shrines, and public buildings for both religious and profane purposes. (See the official site of the Greek Ministry of Culture for description of the site and practical information)
The flame for each modern Olympic Games is still lit in the town, by a reflection of sunlight in a parabolic mirror, and carried by torch to the place where the games are to be held.
Olympia (Greece).description: (Ὀλυμπία) — sanctuary dedicated to Zeus, site of the ancient Olympics

Mývatn.title: Mývatn
Mývatn.summary: Mývatn is a lake near Akureyri in North Iceland.  The lake was formed during a massive eruption 2300 years ago.  Today the area is best known for the huge numbers of birds that visit in the summer, and for the weird and inspiring volcanic features that surround the lake.  The name "Mývatn" is derived from the vast numbers of midges that gather at the lake and are sure to leave an impression on all who visit!
Mývatn.description: (MEE-fatn) - A lake region near Akureyri in the North of Iceland, Mývatn has an unearthly appearance owing to special types of volcanic craters throughout the lake. There are plenty of activities in this area: Smajfall (desert where sulphuric steam comes out of the ground) and Dimmuborgir (aka the Black City and the Gates of Hell).

Lethem.title: Lethem
Lethem.summary: Lethem is a border town of 3,000 in Guyana. It's right across the border from the Brazilian town of Bonfim.

Lake Yojoa.title: Lake Yojoa
Lake Yojoa.summary: Lake Yojoa (Lago de Yojoa) is the largest natural lake in Honduras with a surface area of 79 km² (30.49 mi²) and an elevation of 700 m (2,297 ft).
Lake Yojoa.description: the biggest lake in Honduras which  is famous for its fried fish. Nearby are two national parks that hold pristine rainforest and cloud forest as well as Honduras's first microbrewery.

Egilsstaðir.title: Egilsstaðir
Egilsstaðir.description: (AY-yill-stath-ihr) — Main town in the East, has some of the best weather Iceland has to offer

Conakry.title: Conakry
Conakry.summary: Conakry is the capital of Guinea and the economic, commercial and trade center for the area.

Trinidad.title: Trinidad
Trinidad.summary: Trinidad is the larger of the two islands that make up the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad and Tobago.

San Pedro Sula.title: San Pedro Sula
San Pedro Sula.summary: San Pedro Sula is in northern Honduras. It is the second largest city in Honduras after the capital Tegucigalpa. The focus of industry in Honduras, it is mostly a modern city (unlike more picturesque Comayagua, Tegucigalpa, etc.) It is a good base for entering the country and visiting other parts, and offers modern amenites.
San Pedro Sula.description: located in the Sula Valley in the northwest corner of the country, this is a major transportation and economic hub.

Blue Lagoon.title: Blue Lagoon
Blue Lagoon.summary: Blue Lagoon (Icelandic: Bláa Lónið) (BLAU-ah LONE-eeth) is a geothermal spa in southwest Iceland, that is almost mid-way between Keflavik Airport and Reykjavík, close to the town of Grindavik. Entry starts at 6,990 kr per person (Aug 2019) and rises rapidly from there. This is a very popular tourist destination, attended by over 80% of tourists (around 1.3 million in 2017).
Blue Lagoon.description: (Icelandic: Bláa Lónið) (BLAU-ah LONE-eeth) Famous outdoor pool and health centre. The spa is in Grindavík on the Reykjanes Peninsula, south-western Iceland. It is situated approximately 13 km (8 mi) from the Keflavík International Airport and 39 km (24 mi) from Reykjavík. This geothermal spa in the middle of a lava field with its milky blue water is quite surreal.

Meteora.title: Meteora
Meteora.summary: Meteora (Greek:  Μετέωρα, Metéora) is one of the gems of Greece. Near the town of Kalambaka (Καλαμπάκα, Kalabáka) (Population: 21,991 (2011)) in northwestern Thessaly, it consists of a number of rock pinnacles topped with a total of 24 monasteries, 6 of which are still in use and open to visitors, while the others are abandoned.

Hafnarfjörður.title: Hafnarfjörður
Hafnarfjörður.summary: Hafnarfjörður is a town in Southwest Iceland with a population of 25,000. It has a long history as a town (by Icelandic standards) but has today become a suburb of Reykjavík and the westernmost town in the contiguous urban area of the capital.
Hafnarfjörður.description: (HAP-nar-FYERTH-er)  — Cozy town on the outskirts of the capital region

Húsavík.title: Húsavík
Húsavík.summary: Húsavík is a town of approximately 2,500 inhabitants in North Iceland. It is the whale watching capital of Iceland, with whales sighted on over 95% of trips during the summer. Additionally, it gained some fame when it used to house the (in)famous Icelandic Phallological Museum, which has since moved to Reykjavík.
Húsavík.description: (HOOS-ah-veek) — One of the world's most reliable whale watching sites during the summer

Konark.title: Konark
Konark.summary: Konark or Konarak (Odia: 6କଣାର୍କ)(Sanskrit: कोनार्क) is a small town in Puri district of the state of Odisha (formerly Orissa), India, on the Bay of Bengal, 65 kilometres from Bhubaneswar, famous for its 13th-century Sun Temple and the Chandrabhaga River.
Konark.description: Sun Temple, a unique example of Kalingan architecture, which is a UNESCO World Heritage site

Grenada (island).title: Grenada (island)
Grenada (island).summary: Grenada is the main island of the Caribbean nation of Grenada.

Mount Athos.title: Mount Athos
Mount Athos.summary: Mount Athos (Άγιο Όρος Ayio Oros, classically Ἅγιον Ὄρος Agion Oros) is a mountain and a peninsula in Macedonia, northern Greece and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Mount Athos.description: (Άθως, Áthos) — semi-independent republic, home to many Orthodox monasteries (access restricted)

Santorini.title: Santorini
Santorini.summary: Santorini (officially Thira) is a volcanic island in the Cyclades group of the Greek islands in the southern Aegean Sea, about 200 km southeast of mainland Greece. It is located between Ios and Anafi islands. Thira is essentially what remained after an enormous volcanic explosion that destroyed the earliest settlements on a formerly single island, and created the current geological caldera. It is famous for dramatic views, stunning sunsets from Oia town, the strange white aubergine (eggplant), the town of Thira, an active volcano, and its beautiful beaches (e.g., Perissa—possibly the best beach in Thira, the black pebble beach of Kamari, white beach, and red beach).
sights: Monastery of Saint John the Theologian
Santorini.description: (Σαντορίνη or Θήρα, Thira) — a volcanic island known for its beautiful views, towns and sunsets

Höfn.title: Höfn
Höfn.summary: Höfn (pronounced something like "herpn", also known as Höfn í Hornafirði, is a town in East Iceland, at the south-eastern corner of the country. Höfn sits by the lagoon (or fjord) Hornafjörður which is also the name of the large municipality of which the town is the centre and which covers the entire area of the county Austur-Skaftafellssýsla. This guide covers the town and the surrounding municipality, excluding the westernmost part which forms one of the main gateways to Vatnajökull National Park. For tourism purposes, the area calls itself the Vatnajökull Region: nowhere else is quite as dominated by Europe's largest glacier, nowhere else have people learned to live in such close quarters with the huge sheet of ice.

links.text: bus routes in East Iceland on the Strætó site

Höfn.description: (HEP'n) — Main town on the southeastern coast

Quetzaltenango.title: Quetzaltenango
Quetzaltenango.summary: Quetzaltenango, also known as Xela (pronounced SHAY-la) or Xelaju, is the second largest city in Guatemala. There are a number of attractions in town, and it's also a good base for exploring Guatemala's Western Highlands ("Los Altos"). Situated at the southwest of the country, the surrounding department has a variety of landscapes extending from the cold highlands to the warm Pacific coast. There are numerous volcanos, hot springs, valleys, mountains, rivers. The region provides a harvest of numerous products such as coffee, wheat, fruits and vegetables, and has sheep and cattle breeding.
Quetzaltenango.description: Second largest city, in the western highlands.  Commonly called "Xela".

Akureyri.title: Akureyri
Akureyri.summary: Akureyri, with a population of around 18,000, is the largest town in Iceland outside the Southwest region, and the unofficial capital of North Iceland.
Akureyri.description: (Ahk-oo-rey-rih) — Capital of the North and the largest town outside the Southwest

Port-au-Prince.title: Port-au-Prince
Port-au-Prince.summary: Port-au-Prince is the capital and largest city of Haiti.
Port-au-Prince.description: Haiti's big, crowded, and chaotic capital city.

Georgetown (Guyana).title: Georgetown (Guyana)
Georgetown (Guyana).summary: Georgetown is the largest city in and capital of Guyana.
Georgetown (Guyana).description: Capital of the country, situated in the county of Demerara

Copán Ruinas.title: Copán Ruinas
Copán Ruinas.summary: Copán was one of the great centers of Maya civilization over a thousand years ago. The beautiful ruins have some of the most impressive pre-Columbian art anywhere. Near the ruins is the village of nearly the same name - Copán Ruinas, with clean hotels and other facilities for visitors. Due to their proximity, both locations are covered by this article.
Copán Ruinas.description: one of the most impressive ruins of the Maya civilization, known for the quality of its sculpture.

Bodh Gaya.title: Bodh Gaya
Bodh Gaya.summary: Bodh Gaya is a village in the state of Bihar. It was the site of the Buddha Shakyamuni's enlightenment, and is the most revered of all Buddhist sacred sites.
Bodh Gaya.description: the main temple complex, which includes the Mahabodhi temple, is the place where the Buddha Sakyamuni attained enlightenment

Tegucigalpa.title: Tegucigalpa
Tegucigalpa.summary: Tegucigalpa is the capital of and largest city in Honduras.
Tegucigalpa.description: the capital and largest city of Honduras with an international airport.

Nyíregyháza.title: Nyíregyháza
Nyíregyháza.summary: Nyíregyháza is the county seat and largest city in Szabolcs-Szatmár-Bereg county in Eastern Hungary.
Nyíregyháza.description: a medium-sized city with a busy water resort, museum village, and annual autumn festival

Bolama.title: Bolama
Bolama.summary: Bolama is a city in Guinea-Bissau.
Bolama.description: capital of the country until 1941, has some magnificent examples of colonial architecture and has been suggested as a world heritage site.

Flores (Guatemala).title: Flores (Guatemala)
Flores (Guatemala).summary: Flores is a town in Petén, Guatemala. The town proper is an island on Lago Petén Itzá, connected to land by a causeway, on the other side of which lie the twin towns Santa Elena and San Benito. All three are often referred to as Flores, and are grouped in one article here accordingly.
Flores (Guatemala).description: Island city capital of Petén, good starting point to access Mayan ruins of Tikal.

Hampi.title: Hampi
Hampi.summary: Hampi, in the state of Karnataka, India,  is the site of the once-magnificent capital of the Vijayanagara Empire. The ruins are a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Hampi.description: the awesome ruins of the empire of Vijayanagara

Khajuraho.title: Khajuraho
Khajuraho.summary: Khajuraho is a small town located in the Bundelkhand region (Chhatarpur District) of Madhya Pradesh and is famous for groups of Hindu and Jain temples. These temples are a UNESCO World Heritage Site for their beautiful and erotic rock carvings.
Khajuraho.description: temple complexes famed for their erotic sculptures

Cacheu.title: Cacheu
Cacheu.summary: Cacheu is a small city in northwestern Guinea-Bissau.
Cacheu.description: Cacheu was once an important place for slave-trading, and there is still a little fort.

Rhodes (city).title: Rhodes (city)
Rhodes (city).summary: Rhodes (Greek: Ρόδος, Ródos) is the largest settlement and capital city of the island of the same name. It is famous as the former site of the Colossus, one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, and as the oldest inhabited medieval town in Europe.
Rhodes (city).description: (Ρόδος, Ródos) — impressive medieval structures, nightlife and beaches

Bafatá.title: Bafatá
Bafatá.summary: Bafatá is a city in Guinea-Bissau.
Bafatá.description: Bafata is a pleasant town with an interesting colonial centre, located on the Rio Gêba. Hometown of Bissau-Guinean patriot Amilcar Cabral. Ask around near the old market to visit his house.

Labadie.title: Labadie
Labadie.summary: Labadee is a port in Northern Haiti. It is a private resort leased by Royal Caribbean International (RCI) for use by its Royal Caribbean Cruise Line and Celebrity Cruise line cruise ships. Royal Caribbean International has contributed the largest proportion of tourist revenue to Haiti since 1986. The resort is completely tourist-oriented and safe as there is a personal security force. A controlled group of Haitian merchants are given sole rights to sell their merchandise and establish their businesses in the resort. The site is fenced off from the surrounding area. The cruise ships anchor either at the pier or offshore and passengers walk from the pier to dry land or are ferried to the resort when ships have to anchor offshore.
Labadie.description: a private port used by cruise ships.

Volos.title: Volos
Volos.summary: Volos (Greek: Βόλος) (Population: 144,449 [2011]) is the 5th biggest city (and 3rd largest port) in Greece, situated in Thessaly, almost in the middle of the distance between Athens (326 km) and Thessaloniki (219 km). Volos is an industrial city with a large port - but there are a few hidden gems here that you might find as you pass through to islands or Pelion.
Volos.description: (Βόλος) — coastal port with nice museums and architecture

Szeged.title: Szeged
Szeged.summary: Szeged is the third-largest city in Hungary is a town in the Great Hungarian Plain. It is known as "the city of sunshine" for its brilliant weather, and for the imposing cathedral, a wealth of Art Nouveau and historicist buildings, and for the fish soup Halászlé.

Agra.title: Agra
Agra.summary: Agra is the city of the Taj Mahal, in the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, some 200 km from Delhi.
Agra.description: the incomparable marble tomb in Agra, one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World

Pécs.title: Pécs
Pécs.summary: Pécs (PEH-ch)  is a town in the south-west of Hungary. Pécs is the administrative and economical centre of Baranya County. The city has a Mediterranean atmosphere and is treasure trove of science, arts and sacrality. It had famous and glorious periods. Here are several values of the Roman times, the Middle Ages, the Turkish occupation and the development of the middle-class are built on one another or next to one another such as Gothic, Renaissance, baroque dwelling houses, Christian churches and Islamic houses of prayer, djamis and minarets, baths and public buildings. It's also an active university city, with some 20,000 students enrolled at the University of Pécs, approximately 4,000 of whom are international students.
Pécs.description: a pleasant cultural centre and university town

Székesfehérvár.title: Székesfehérvár
Székesfehérvár.summary: Székesfehérvár is the largest city and county seat of Fejér county, Hungary. It's roughly 60 km southwest of Budapest, and is considered Hungary's first, as this was the royal seat of King Szent István (also known as Saint Stephan). Though most of the medieval city was destroyed by the Turks, it was rebuilt to glory under Maria Theresa Habsburg. The city is between Lake Velence and Lake Balaton, making it an ideal stop-off between the two.
Székesfehérvár.description: former royal seat, famous for its baroque architecture and museums

Madurai.title: Madurai
Madurai.summary: Madurai (Tamil: மதுரை), formerly Madura, is the third-largest city in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It's on the banks of the river Vaigai, and has been a major settlement for two millennia. It is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world. The city was the capital of the Pandyan kingdom was at Korkai, around 600 BCE, and was moved to Koodal (present-day Madurai) during the reign of Nedunj Cheliyan I.
Madurai.description: a spectacular Hindu temple in Madurai

Varanasi.title: Varanasi
Varanasi.summary: Varanasi, once known as Benares or Banaras and Kashi, is a city at the banks of the Ganges river in northern India. Being the most sacred city in Hinduism and Jainism, and important in the history of Buddhism, Varanasi is India's most important pilgrimage destination.
Varanasi.description: (Banaras or Kashi) — considered the most sacred Hindu city, on the banks of the Ganges, one of the oldest continually inhabited cities in the world

Hyderabad.title: Hyderabad
Hyderabad.summary: Hyderabad, the pearl city of India, is the capital of Telangana in Southern India. It sits on the banks of the Musi River and on the Deccan Plateau. Hyderabad and Secunderabad are "twin cities" near Hussain Sagar Lake (also known as Tank Bund in local parlance) but both cities have grown so much that now they have become one big metropolis. The city and district of Hyderabad are coterminous. Hyderabad district is entirely contained within the Ranga Reddy (formerly "Hyderabad Rural") district of Telangana. Many of the suburbs of Hyderabad have been merged into the city, now called Greater Hyderabad.
Hyderabad.description: known for pearl and diamond trading, now with major manufacturing and financial institutions and a growing IT sector

Antigua Guatemala.title: Antigua Guatemala
Antigua Guatemala.summary: La Antigua Guatemala was the colonial Spanish capital of Central America. It is a World Heritage Site, and is perhaps the most popular tourist destination in Guatemala.
sights: Iglesia de La Merced, Antigua Guatemala
Antigua Guatemala.description: Colonial Spanish capital of Central America, a World Heritage site, and the most popular among tourists

Miskolc.title: Miskolc
Miskolc.summary: Miskolc, with population of about 180,000, is the third largest city in Hungary, located in the north-east of the country, east of Bükk mountains.
sights: Greek Orthodox Church and Museum, Miskolc
Miskolc.description: with the unique cave bath in Miskolc-Tapolca, the third largest city in the country, located near the Bükk hills

Kankan.title: Kankan
Kankan.summary: Kankan is a city in Guinea.

Gracias.title: Gracias
Gracias.summary: Gracias is a city in the Honduran department of Lempira.
Gracias.description: a pleasant colonial mountain town; nearby Parque Celaque is home to the highest mountain in Honduras set among wonderful cloud forests.

Amritsar.title: Amritsar
Amritsar.summary: Amritsar (ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਸਰ) is a city in the state of Punjab, India. It is the holiest city in the Sikh religion.

Jakarta.title: Jakarta
Jakarta.summary: Jakarta is Indonesia's capital and largest city, with about 10 million inhabitants, and a total 30 million in Greater Jakarta on the Java island. Dubbed The Big Durian, an equivalent to New York's Big Apple, its concrete jungle, traffic frenzy, and hot polluted air may tempt you to skip the city as fast as possible, but what awaits inside will change your perspective! One of the most bustling and cosmopolitan cities in Asia, the J-Town has cheerful nightlife, vibrant shopping malls, a variety of foods, refreshing greenery, cultural diversity and a rich history, that caters to all levels of budget and how much fun you want to have.
Jakarta.description: the perennially congested capital which is also the largest city in the country

Mumbai.title: Mumbai
Mumbai.summary: Mumbai (Marathi: मुंबई) (state tourism office), a cosmopolitan  metropolis, earlier known as Bombay, is the largest city in India and the capital of the state Maharashtra. Mumbai was originally a conglomeration of seven islands on the Konkan coastline which over time were joined to form the island city of Bombay. The island was in turn joined with the neighbouring island of Salsette to form Greater Bombay. The city has an estimated metropolitan population of 21 million (2005), making it one of the world's most populous cities.
sights: National Gallery of Modern Art, Mumbai
Mumbai.description: (Bombay) — the largest city and the financial capital of India, the city that never sleeps, home of "Bollywood", the Hindi film industry

Snæfellsjökull National Park.title: Snæfellsjökull National Park
Snæfellsjökull National Park.summary: Snæfellsjökull National Park is a national park located on the tip of the Snæfellsnes Peninsula in West Iceland. The park is home to the ice-covered volcanic crater that was the setting for Jules Verne's book Journey to the Center of the Earth.
Snæfellsjökull National Park.description: (SNY-fetls-yer-CUDDLE) - Located on the tip of the Snæfellsnes Peninsula in western Iceland, this park is home to the ice-covered volcanic crater that was the setting for Jules Verne's book Journey to the Center of the Earth.

Kecskemét.title: Kecskemét
Kecskemét.summary: Kecskemét is a town in central Hungary and the county seat of Bács-Kiskun county, half way between Budapest and Szeged, almost equal distance from the two big rivers of the country, Danube and Tisza. The city is well known for its secessionist architecture, museums, and for being the birthplace of composer Zoltan Kodály.
Kecskemét.description: a town famous for its vibrant music scene, plum brandy, and Art Nouveau architecture

Landmannalaugar.title: Landmannalaugar
Landmannalaugar.description: A region of outstanding natural beauty reachable by bus (or 4x4) from Reykjavík. Situated in the Interior, it gives a taste of the uninhabited highlands at Iceland’s core.

Mykonos.title: Mykonos
Mykonos.summary: Mykonos (Greek: Μύκονος) is a popular tourist destination in the Greek islands of the Cyclades group, situated in the middle of the Aegean Sea. Mykonos is located south of Tinos, east of Syros and north of Paros and Naxos.

links.text: ferries and high speed catamaran services

sights: Monastery of Saint John the Theologian

Vatnajökull National Park.title: Vatnajökull National Park
Vatnajökull National Park.summary: Vatnajökull National Park in Iceland is the largest national park in Europe and a natural world heritage site.  The park was founded on 7 June 2008 and includes the former Skaftafell and Jökulsárgljúfur National Parks.  Containing 12,000 km2 the park covers about 12% of the surface of Iceland.  The park is home to Iceland's highest mountain (Hvannadalshnúkur), largest glacier (Vatnajökull), and Europe's most powerful waterfall (Dettifoss).
Vatnajökull National Park.description: (VAT-nah-yer-CUDDLE) - Iceland's newest national park was founded in 2008 and includes the former Skaftafell and Jokulsargljufur National Parks. Vatnajökull National Park is Europe's largest national park at 12,000 square kilometres (4,600 sq mi), covering about 12% of the surface of Iceland. The park is home to Iceland's highest mountain, Hvannadalshnúkur, largest glacier, Vatnajökull, and Europe's largest waterfall in terms of volume discharge, Dettifoss.

Kaieteur National Park.title: Kaieteur National Park
Kaieteur National Park.summary: Kaieteur National Park is in the highlands of Guyana. The park offers a genuine Amazonian experience for lovers of the jungle.

Hortobágy.title: Hortobágy
Hortobágy.summary: National Park Hortobágy - The Puszta is a first and biggest national park in Hungary. The park is a part of the Northern Great Plain (Alföld) and is listed on the UNESCO World Heritage site.
Hortobágy.description: Hungary's largest protected area and the largest semi-natural grassland in Europe

Delhi.title: Delhi
Delhi.summary: Delhi (Hindi: दिल्ली, Punjabi: ਦਿੱਲੀ, Urdu: دلّی) is India's capital and seat of government. It forms the National Capital Territory of Delhi, rather than being part of a state. Delhi is one of India's largest cities, and the core of one of the largest metropolitan areas in the world, with over 21 million inhabitants. Within India it is a major center of arts, commerce, education, tourism, and transit. As the capital of several empires over the last 2000 years, Delhi also contains a striking array of well-preserved historic sites for the tourist to visit.
Delhi.description: the capital of India and the heart of Northern India

Jaipur.title: Jaipur
Jaipur.summary: Jaipur, also known as the Pink City, is the capital of Indian state of Rajasthan, and its largest city. The city was built in the 18th century by Sawai Jai Singh as India's first planned city, and today it's a major tourist attraction for Indians and for international visitors. It is a very picturesque city with splendid palaces, forts and historical monuments and belongs to the tourist Golden Triangle along with Delhi and Agra. It hosts several attractions including the City Palace, Govind Dev ji Temple, Vidhan Sabha, Birla Temple and several massive Rajput forts. It also serves as a stepping stone for those heading to the desert cities of Jodhpur and Jaisalmer.
Jaipur.description: the Pink City, a major exhibit of the Hindu Rajput culture of medieval Northern India

Monterrico.title: Monterrico
Monterrico.summary: Monterrico is the most popular beach in Guatemala and also the closest to Guatemala City and Antigua. The beaches are full of interesting but awkward steep angles due to the strength of the pounding surf. The ocean floor here drops off very steeply after only 20- 40 feet, making the undertow here very strong; only strong swimmers should venture out very far. This topography also provides some nice waves for surfing. There are lifeguards on duty during the weekend. Don't forget to bring some sandals as the sand is of the black volcanic variety. It is a stunning feature for the beauty of it, but it is too hot to walk on after 10am. The beach is 15-25 m (50-80 feet) wide and stretches for miles. It is busiest(not crowded by any measure) on Sunday with mostly Guatemalans.
Monterrico.description: The beach closest to Guatemala City and Antigua, volcanic sand.

La Ceiba.title: La Ceiba
La Ceiba.summary: La Ceiba is a city on the north Caribbean coast of Honduras, 202 km from San Pedro Sula.
La Ceiba.description: port city on Caribbean coast with great beaches and daily ferries to the Bay Islands.

Þingvellir National Park.title: Þingvellir National Park
Þingvellir National Park.summary: Þingvellir National Park (pronounced Thingvetlir) is a national park in South Iceland and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  The park is home to the world's longest running Parliament, first established in 930 AD, and also has a dramatic landscape formed as a result of sitting along the border between the North American and European tectonic plates.
Þingvellir National Park.description: (pronounced "THING-vet-lihr") - National Park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. 30 to 50 kilometres (19 to 31 mi) east of Reykjavík. Interesting for a number of reasons: it is the original site of the longest running parliament in the world (the name literally means 'parliamentary fields'), and it's where the North-American and European continental shelf plates are being torn apart.

Bissau.title: Bissau
Bissau.summary: Bissau is the largest city in and capital of Guinea-Bissau.

Panajachel.title: Panajachel
Panajachel.summary: Panajachel is in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Panajachel, or Pana as it is widely known is a small town on the North shore of Lake Atitlán. Pana is a small town with a booming tourist industry. With the exception of possibly Antigua, Panajachel is one of the major tourism areas in Guatemala.
Panajachel.description: Gateway to Lake Atitlán, a beautiful and busy tourist area

Debrecen.title: Debrecen
Debrecen.summary: Debrecen is the "capital city of the Great Hungarian Plain", and the county seat and largest city of Hajdú-Bihar county in eastern Hungary. It is the second largest city in the country with about 200,000 inhabitants, and historically the most important city in Hungarian Protestantism.
Debrecen.description: the second largest city in the country

Kochi.title: Kochi
Kochi.summary: Kochi (formerly Cochin; Malayalam: കൊച്ചി) is a cosmopolitan city in Kerala with a bustling commercial port. Kochi is the financial and commercial capital of Kerala and, with a population of more than 2 million, the biggest conurbation in the state.
Kochi.description: (Cochin) — the Queen of the Arabian Sea, historically a centre of international trade, now the gateway to the sandy beaches and backwaters

Budapest.title: Budapest
Budapest.summary: Budapest is the capital city of Hungary. With a unique, youthful atmosphere, world-class classical music scene, a pulsating nightlife increasingly appreciated among European youth, and last but not least, an exceptional offer of natural thermal baths, Budapest is one of Europe's most delightful and enjoyable cities. Due to the exceedingly scenic setting, and its architecture it is nicknamed "Paris of the East".
Budapest.description: with green filled parks, interesting museums, and a pulsating nightlife, Budapest is one of Europe's most delightful and enjoyable cities

Reykjavík.title: Reykjavík
Reykjavík.summary: Reykjavík is the capital of and largest city in Iceland and with an urban area population of around 200,000, it is the home to two-thirds of Iceland's population. It is the centre of culture and life of the Icelandic people, and is one of the focal points of tourism in Iceland. The city is spread out, and has sprawling suburbs. The city centre, however, is a very small area characterised by eclectic and colourful houses, with good shopping, dining and drinking. Reykjavik has the distinction of being the northernmost capital city in the world, though its winters are surprisingly mild for a city of its latitude.
Reykjavík.description: (REYG-ya-veeg) — The capital of Iceland and the largest city

Bangalore.title: Bangalore
Bangalore.summary: Bangalore, now known officially as Bengaluru (Kannada: ಬೆಂಗಳೂರು), is the capital of the Indian state of Karnataka.
Bangalore.description: (Bengaluru) — the beautiful garden city, once the sleepy home of pension takers, now transformed into an IT hub for high-technology companies and sprouting pubs.

Chennai.title: Chennai
Chennai.summary: Chennai (formerly Madras; Tamil: சென்னை), is the capital of the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu. With a population of 8.6 million (2011 census), Chennai's urbanized area is the most populous in southern India and the fourth most populous in India. It is situated on the east coast of peninsular India.
sights: Church of Our Lady of Light, Chennai
Chennai.description: (Madras) — the main port in Southern India, cultural centre, automobile capital of India and a fast emerging IT hub

Guatemala City.title: Guatemala City
Guatemala City.summary: Guatemala City is the capital of Guatemala, a country in Central America.

links.text: Fuentes Del Norte (FDN), Maya De Oro

Guatemala City.description: Capital and largest city with many amenities

Connemara.title: Connemara
Connemara.summary: Connemara, in the northwest of County Galway, West Ireland has scenery like that out of a fairy tale.  Its mountains are a deep and rich colour of green.
Connemara.description: (Conamara) — an Irish speaking region in Western County Galway

Champasak.title: Champasak
Champasak.summary: Champasak is a province of Southern Laos.  It's best known for a series of Khmer ruins, collectively named a UNESCO World Heritage Site as the Champasak Cultural Landscape.
Champasak.description: Wat Phu is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with Angkor-style Khmer temples

Ring of Kerry.title: Ring of Kerry
Ring of Kerry.summary: The Ring of Kerry is probably the most visited attraction in Ireland outside of Dublin.
Ring of Kerry.description: and Skellig Michael — (Sceilg Mhichíl) in County Kerry

Amalfi Coast.title: Amalfi Coast
Amalfi Coast.summary: The Amalfi Coast lies in the southwestern region of Campania, Italy. For its extraordinary beauty and its iconic medieval cliffside Mediterranean fishing villages, it is recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Amalfi Coast.description: (Italian: Costiera Amalfitana) — stunningly beautiful rocky coastline, so popular that private cars are banned in the summer months

Ar Rutba.title: Ar Rutba
Ar Rutba.summary: Ar Rutba is a city in the Iraqi Desert. It is the westernmost town of any real size. Ar Rutba is a Sunni-majority city and was most notably the site of a large part of the old Iraqi air defense warning system, housing a number of military personnel there. The warning station was destroyed in the 1990-91 Gulf War. It was seized by ISIS in 2014, but has since been liberated by Iraqi Security Forces.
Ar Rutba.description: (الرطبة) — most isolated town in Iraq, deep in the desert.

North Montenegrin Mountains.title: North Montenegrin Mountains
North Montenegrin Mountains.summary: Northern Mountains is a region of Montenegro.

Pasargad.title: Pasargad
Pasargad.summary: Pasargad is a historical site near Shiraz, in Fars province. It is the site of the tomb of Cyrus the Great.
Pasargad.description: (Persian: پاسارگاد) – the first capital of the Achaemenid Empire, and home to the tomb of Cyrus the Great.

Northeastern Albania.title: Northeastern Albania
Northeastern Albania.summary: Northeastern Albania is a region of Albania.

Talas.title: Talas
Talas.summary: Talas is a modern town of the Talas Province in the Bishkek and the Northwest region of Kyrgyzstan with a population of about 30,000.
Talas.description: – A modern far off town with the popular Manar Ordo pilgrimage complex nearby, just north of Besh-Tash National Park.

Brod.title: Brod
Brod.summary: Brod is a village in Kosovo.

Jayapura.title: Jayapura
Jayapura.summary: Jayapura is the capital and largest city in Papua, Indonesia. The city has also been known in the past as Hollandia (1910-1962), Kota Baru (1962-1963) and even Sukarnopura (1963-1968).
Jayapura.description: the capital of Papua and a gateway to the highlands

Jezreel Valley.title: Jezreel Valley
Jezreel Valley.summary: The Jezreel Valley is an extensive inland valley large valley, largely rural, located in northern Israel.
Jezreel Valley.description: – an extensive inland valley, largely rural, extending inland from east of Haifa to the Jordan Valley

Naryn.title: Naryn
Naryn.summary: Naryn is a city in southeastern Kyrgyzstan, high in the Tian Shan Mountains with a population of 52,300 residents.
Naryn.description: – A city right up in the Tian Shan, near Lake Song Kul, the gateway to the entire southeastern region, its ruins, mountains, and high alpine lakes.

Bishkek and the Northwest.title: Bishkek and the Northwest
Bishkek and the Northwest.summary: Bishkek and the Northwest occupy the northern and northwest parts of Kyrgyzstan, north of the Ferghana Valley and south of Kazakhstan.
Bishkek and the Northwest.description: One of the highlights of Kyrgyzstan with a beautiful lake, excellent hiking, diverse flora and fauna, picturesque mountains and much more.

Miyajima.title: Miyajima
Miyajima.summary: Miyajima (宮島) is one of the crown jewels of Japan, and certainly one of its finest views. Located off the coast of Hiroshima, the serene beauty of the island is an essential coda to that city.
sights: Sites of Japan’s Meiji Industrial Revolution: Iron and Steel, Shipbuilding and Coal Mining
Miyajima.description: just off Hiroshima, site of the iconic floating torii

Semey.title: Semey
Semey.summary: Semey (Kazakh: Семей), formerly known as Semipalatinsk (Russian: Семипала́тинск, until 2007) and Alash-kala (Kazakh: Алаш-қала / Alaş-qala, 1917–1920), is a city in Kazakhstan with population of around 300,000 people.
Semey.description: (Semipalatinsk) — university city notorious for the nearby atomic bomb testing site

Ferizaj.title: Ferizaj
Ferizaj.summary: Ferizaj is a town in Kosovo, just west of the main highway linking the national capital, Pristina, with the Macedonian border.

Ajlun.title: Ajlun
Ajlun.summary: Ajlun (also Ajloun) is a city in Northern Jordan.
Ajlun.description: Castle — impressive ruins of a 12th-century castle

Azraq.title: Azraq
Azraq.summary: Azraq ( الأزرق ) is a historic wetland in the Jordanian Eastern Desert.
Azraq.description: oasis in the desert, an illustration of how water brings life even at places like a desert

Rosh Haniqra.title: Rosh Haniqra
Rosh Haniqra.summary: Rosh Haniqra (Hebrew: ראש הנקרה "head of the rock caves"; also transliterated Rosh Hanikra) is a dazzlingly white coastal rock cliff formation on the far northern coast of Israel, next to the Lebanese border.
Rosh Haniqra.description: – spectacular caverns on Israel's Mediterranean coast in the Western Galilee in the north of Israel, near the northern border with Lebanon.

Karbala.title: Karbala
Karbala.summary: Karbala (Arabic: كربلاء‎‎) is a city in Southern Iraq. It is considered one of the holiest cities in the country.
Karbala.description: (كربلاء) — one of the holiest cities in Shi'a Islam. The Arbaeen pilgrimage brings millions of Muslims to the Imam Husayn Shrine here every year.

Turkestan.title: Turkestan
Turkestan.summary: Turkestan (Kazakh: Түркістан Türkistan) is a small but ancient city in the Kazakh Desert. Kazakhstan largely lacks the kinds of Central Asian historical towns that make Uzbekistan a popular travel destination, but the exception is this one, relatively well preserved, 1600-year-old city. In the 11th century AD, the great Sufi Sheikh Khoja Ahmad Yasavi turned the city into the region's principal centre of learning, drawing scholars from across the steppe. In the late 14th century, Timur commissioned the creation of a massive mausoleum in his honour, which is to this day Kazakhstan's most prominent historical attraction, a major Muslim pilgrimage site, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Turkestan.description: another ancient city, long a border town between the Persian culture to the south and the Turkic nomadic culture to the north, now majority Uzbek and home to several important cultural-historical monuments

Carmel Range.title: Carmel Range
Carmel Range.summary: The Carmel Range, often referred to simply as "Mount Carmel" (though this more properly refers to the hills immediately above Haifa), is a compact region of hills in Israel extending westwards from the Central Hill country to the Mediterranean Sea.
Carmel Range.description: – a forested hilly region along the Mediterranean coast, southeast of Haifa

Falmouth (Jamaica).title: Falmouth (Jamaica)
Falmouth (Jamaica).summary: Falmouth is a town in Jamaica.
Falmouth (Jamaica).description: Chief town and capital of Trelawny Parish, Jamaica

Vesuvius.title: Vesuvius
Vesuvius.summary: Mount Vesuvius (Italian: Monte Vesuvio) is a volcanic mountain in the Campania region of Italy, overshadowing the Bay of Naples.
Vesuvius.description: (Italian: Monte Vesuvio) — the famous dormant volcano with a stunning view of the Bay of Naples

Pakbeng.title: Pakbeng
Pakbeng.summary: Pakbeng is in Bakeo Province, Northern Laos.
Pakbeng.description: halfway point on the overnight slow boat between Huay Xai and Luang Prabang

Tana Toraja.title: Tana Toraja
Tana Toraja.summary: Tana Toraja, literally "Torajaland", is a highland region of Southern Sulawesi in Indonesia.
Tana Toraja.description: highland area of Southern Sulawesi famed for extraordinary funeral rites

Yaeyama Islands.title: Yaeyama Islands
Yaeyama Islands.summary: The Yaeyama Islands (八重山諸島 Yaeyama-shotō) are the westernmost part of Okinawa, Japan.
Yaeyama Islands.description: the farthest-flung bit of Okinawa, with spectacular diving, beaches and jungle cruising

Capri.title: Capri
Capri.summary: The small Italian island of Capri is situated 5 km from the mainland in the Bay of Naples, a celebrated beauty spot and coastal resort since the days of the Roman Republic until now. It is also part of Campania.
Capri.description: the famed island in the Bay of Naples, which was a favored resort of the Roman emperors

Masada.title: Masada
Masada.summary: Masada (Hebrew: מצדה) is a magnificently located fortress site in Israel's stark Judaean Desert, close to the Dead Sea. The last Jewish holdout to fall to Rome in 73 CE, Masada symbolizes the exile of the Jewish nation from the Holy Land. Its violent end has become a symbol of bravery and self-sacrifice since the founding of the State of Israel in 1948.
Masada.description: – high on a plateau above the Dead Sea, the scene of the Zealots' last stand against the might of Rome. A UNESCO World Heritage site.

Umm Qais.title: Umm Qais
Umm Qais.summary: Umm Qais is a Roman ruin in Northern Jordan.
Umm Qais.description: a Roman-era settlement, close to the ruins of the ancient Gadara

Caesarea.title: Caesarea
Caesarea.summary: Caesarea (Hebrew: Qeysarya, קיסריה) is a small, wealthy town and extensive archaeological site on the Mediterranean coast of Israel, located some 50 km north of Tel Aviv and several kilometres north of Hadera. Population 4,200. Caesarea is close to Jisr az-Zarqa, an Arab village which has a backpacker guest house. In between the two are some of the most beautiful beaches in Israel.
Caesarea.description: – an ancient Roman and Crusader city with well-preserved remains

Lake Como.title: Lake Como
Lake Como.summary: Lake Como (Lago di Como; also called: Lario) is in the provinces of Como and Lecco in Lombardy, Northern Italy. It is part of the Italian Lake District. It has been popular with visitors since the early 20th century for its combination of fresh air, water, mountains and good weather.
Lake Como.description: (Italian: Lago di Como) — its atmosphere has been appreciated for its beauty and uniqueness since Roman times

Aran Islands.title: Aran Islands
Aran Islands.summary: The Aran Islands in County Galway, Ireland, are an archipelago of three small islands, the largest of which - Inis Mór - is only 12km by 3km in size.  All are barren, rocky islands with some of the most beautiful scenery in the world.

Lake Garda.title: Lake Garda
Lake Garda.summary: Lake Garda is a lake in the north of Italy, and the surrounding region. It is a popular holiday location.
Lake Garda.description: (Italian: Lago di Garda) — a beautiful lake in Northern Italy surrounded by many small villages

Mitrovica.title: Mitrovica
Mitrovica.summary: Mitrovica or Mitrovicë is a city in northern Kosovo, split between a southern ethnic-Albanian section and a northern ethnic-Serbian section.

Borobudur.title: Borobudur
Borobudur.summary: Borobudur is a Buddhist stupa and temple complex in Central Java, Indonesia dating from the 8th century, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This is one of world's truly great ancient monuments, the single largest Buddhist structure anywhere on earth, and few who visit fail to be taken by both the scale of place, and the remarkable attention to detail that went into the construction. Set as it is in the heart of the verdant Kedu Plain, the backdrop of mighty active volcanoes only enhances the sense of awe and drama.
Borobudur.description: one of the largest Buddhist temples in the world located in Central Java province; often combined with a visit to the equally impressive Hindu ruins at nearby Prambanan

Mount Fuji.title: Mount Fuji
Mount Fuji.summary: Mount Fuji (富士山 Fuji-san, 3776 meters) is Japan's highest mountain and the focal point of the sprawling Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park.  Visible from Tokyo on a clear day, the mountain is located to the west of Tokyo on the main island Honshu, straddling the border between Shizuoka and Yamanashi prefectures.
Mount Fuji.description: iconic snow-topped volcano, and highest peak in Japan (3776m)

Muang Xay.title: Muang Xay
Muang Xay.summary: Muang Xay (ເມືອງໄຊ) (also ອຸດົມໄຊ Oudomxay, Udomxai, etc.) is the capital of the multi-ethnic Oudomxay Province, in the Nam Ko River Basin and surrounded by scenic mountains. It's the largest city in Northern Laos and, if you're travelling by land, you'll probably end up here at some point.
Muang Xay.description: also known as Oudomxay, the capital of the multi-ethnic province of Oudomxay

Si Phan Don.title: Si Phan Don
Si Phan Don.summary: Si Phan Don (Four Thousand Islands, Lao: ສີພັນດອນ) is a group of islands in the Mekong River in Southern Laos.
Si Phan Don.description: the "four thousand islands" are nestled within the Mekong near the Cambodian border

Kerak.title: Kerak
Kerak.summary: Kerak (also spelt Karak, Arabic al-Kerak) is a small, Arab city (population 170,000) in southern Jordan.
Kerak.description: site of a once-mighty Crusader castle

Dingle Peninsula.title: Dingle Peninsula
Dingle Peninsula.summary: The Dingle Peninsula is the smaller and northernmost of the two peninsulas that make up County Kerry, in Southwest Ireland.
Dingle Peninsula.description: (Corca Dhuibhne) — a Gaeltecht region (Irish-speaking district) in the very South West corner of Ireland

Shymkent.title: Shymkent
Shymkent.summary: Shymkent (Kazakh: Шымкент) is a city in the Kazakh Desert, and is the third largest city in Kazakhstan.
Shymkent.description: Kazakhstan's third largest city, very crowded with Uzbek people, it is an old market town located near Tashkent and some beautiful mountains; now booming with oil exploration

Basra.title: Basra
Basra.summary: Basra (Arabic: البصرة Al Baṣrah) is a port city in Southern Iraq, very close to the border with Kuwait. It is Iraq's third largest city with a population of 2,150,000 (2017).
Basra.description: (البَصرة) — large port city with extremely hot climate.

Persepolis.title: Persepolis
Persepolis.summary: Persepolis  is a historical site 60 km north of Shiraz, in Fars province. It was the ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire (550–330 BC), inscribed in the UNESCO list in 1979.
Persepolis.description: – impressive ruins of a vast city-like complex built over 2,500 years ago, near the modern city of Shiraz. It was set on fire by Alexander of Macedon and further ruined by Arabs. Called TakhteJamshid in Persian, Persepolis is the symbol of Iranian nationality.

Qom.title: Qom
Qom.summary: Qom (Persian: قم) is a holy city between Tehran and Isfahan.  Qom is 120 km from Tehran.
Qom.description: (Persian: قم‎‎) – one of the holiest cities in the Middle East, considered the Jewel of Iran

Sea of Galilee region.title: Sea of Galilee region
Sea of Galilee region.summary: The Sea of Galilee (Hebrew: Yam Kinneret) is the largest freshwater lake of Israel.
Sea of Galilee region.description: – the home of Jesus of Nazareth and the largest freshwater lake in the country

Dana Nature Reserve.title: Dana Nature Reserve
Dana Nature Reserve.summary: Dana Nature Reserve is in Jordan, 88 km south of Kerak.
Dana Nature Reserve.description: stay in a traditional village and enjoy unforgettable hiking in an offshoot of the Great Rift

Gjilani.title: Gjilani
Gjilani.summary: Gjilan is a town in Kosovo, in the southeast linked with the highway of Pristina, Serbian Border and North Macedonian Border.

Jerash.title: Jerash
Jerash.summary: Jerash, a city in northern Jordan, is famous for its Roman ruins. The archaeological site is popular for tourists, second only to Petra.
Jerash.description: one of the largest Roman ruins in the Middle East

Herculaneum.title: Herculaneum
Herculaneum.summary: Herculaneum (it: Ercolano) is a town close to Naples in Campania, Italy. It is named after the ruined Roman city which forms its main attraction. Herculaneum was destroyed by an eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in AD 79, the same eruption that destroyed Pompeii. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Herculaneum.description: and  (Italian: Ercolano) — two suburbs of Naples covered by an eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in AD 79, now excavated to reveal life as it was in Roman times

Komodo National Park.title: Komodo National Park
Komodo National Park.summary: Komodo National Park is in the Nusa Tenggara region of Indonesia, between the islands of Sumbawa and Flores.
Komodo National Park.description: home of the Komodo dragon and a hugely important marine ecosystem

Skellig Michael.title: Skellig Michael
Skellig Michael.summary: Skellig Michael (Irish: Sceilig Mhichíl) is a small island in Ireland off the coast of County Kerry.

links.text: Murphy Sea Cruise-Boat trips to Skellig Rock

Kerman.title: Kerman
Kerman.summary: Kerman is the capital of Kerman, in southeastern Iran.
Kerman.description: (Persian: کرمان) – this south-eastern city is one of the five historical cities of Iran.

Osh.title: Osh
Osh.summary: Osh is a city in the Ferghana Valley of Kyrgyzstan.
Osh.description: – Kyrgyzstan's second largest city, a fascinating, 3,000 years old, wildly diverse, Ferghana Valley market town home to Central Asia's biggest and busiest outdoor market.

Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan.title: Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan
Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan.summary: Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan is a region in the east of Kyrgyzstan.
Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan.description: A former well-preserved 15th century stone caravanserai near Naryn and must see.

Bunaken.title: Bunaken
Bunaken.summary: Bunaken National Marine Park is off the coast of Northern Sulawesi, Indonesia.
Bunaken.description: one of the best scuba diving destinations in Indonesia, if not the world

County Donegal.title: County Donegal
County Donegal.summary: County Donegal, is in Northwest Ireland and Lakelands and is the northernmost county in Ireland, stretching further to the north than any part of Northern Ireland.
County Donegal.description: (Contae Dhún na nGall) — the coastal regions of this county have spectacular scenery and excellent beaches

Glendalough.title: Glendalough
Glendalough.summary: Glendalough is a historically important monastery & village in County Wicklow in Ireland. Glendalough lies roughly 90 minutes south of Dublin by car.
Glendalough.description: (Gleann Dá Loch) — fine ruins and hiking trails in Co. Wicklow

Gjakova.title: Gjakova
Gjakova.summary: Gjakova/Gjakovë (Albanian) Đakovica (Serbian) is a city in western Kosovo with about 101,000 inhabitants.

Luang Namtha.title: Luang Namtha
Luang Namtha.summary: Luang Namtha (ຫຼວງນໍ້າທາ, ຫລວງນໍ້າທາ Louangnamtha, Luang Nam Tha) is the largest city in Luang Nam Tha Province, Northern Laos. It lies on the banks of the Nam Tha River, and the meaning of the name is "The area (luang) around the Tha River (nam Tha)".
Luang Namtha.description: capital of the north, known for its trekking

Tha Khaek.title: Tha Khaek
Tha Khaek.summary: Tha Khek (ທ່າແຂກ) is the main town in Khammouane Province, in Central Laos.
Tha Khaek.description: a popular base for exploring Phou Hin Boun National Park including the famous Konglor Cave

Peja.title: Peja
Peja.summary: Peja (Peja/Pejë in Albanian or Peć in Serbian), is a city in northwestern Kosovo.

Alps.title: Alps
Alps.summary: The Alps are a range of mountains in Europe caused by uplift in the European Plate as it is impacted by the African Plate moving north; they stretch from Italy through France, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Germany, Austria, and into Slovenia.
Alps.description: (Italian: Alpi) — some of the most beautiful mountains in Europe, including Mont Blanc and Mount Rosa

Killarney.title: Killarney
Killarney.summary: Killarney is a small town in southwest Ireland. Situated on the Ring of Kerry scenic drive, it's one of Ireland's leading tourist destinations because of the abundant lake and mountain scenery in Killarney National Park.
Killarney.description: (Cill Áirne)— Possibly, the most popular tourist destination in Ireland. A pleasant town in its own right, it is also the start of most Ring of Kerry trips.

Sde Boker.title: Sde Boker
Sde Boker.summary: Sde Boker is a kibbutz in the central Negev (the south of Israel), most famous for being the past residence of the first prime minister of Israel, David Ben-Gurion, who moved there after he left his office in order to live his ideals of settling the Negev. The name Sde Boker also commonly refers to the nearby ecologic settlement and educational complex, the Ben-Gurion College, at the edge of which is the tomb of the late prime minister and his wife, set on the ridge overlooking the mighty Zin Valley.
Sde Boker.description: – beautiful steep canyon and a popular hiking spot

Nazareth.title: Nazareth
Nazareth.summary: Nazareth (Arabic الناصرة an-Nāṣirah, Hebrew נצרת Nasarat) is a city in northern Israel. It is the largest Arab city in Israel proper, having a population of 60,000, a harmonious mix of Muslims (70%) and Christians (about 30%).
sights: Greek Orthodox Church of the Annunciation
Nazareth.description: – the hometown of Jesus, now the largest Arab city in Israel

Kinsale.title: Kinsale
Kinsale.summary: Kinsale (Irish: Cionn tSáile) is a small town in County Cork, Southwest Ireland.
Kinsale.description: (Cionn tSáile) — gastronomic excellence in Ireland's oldest town

Akko.title: Akko
Akko.summary: Akko(עכו), also known historically to Arabs as عكّا ('Akka) and Westerners as Acre, lies on the northern edge of the Bay of Acre in northern Israel and receives many Baha'i pilgrims. On its present site, Akko possesses a long history of various cultures: Israelites, Greeks, Romans, Crusaders and Arabs. Akko is a holy city in the Bahá'í Faith and has been recognised as a UNESCO World Heritage Site as a site of extraordinary significance to the world’s cultural heritage.
Akko.description: (Acre) – an ancient town with a historic port and the most sacred Baha'i site. Its coastal old town is  particularly beautiful

Sigulda.title: Sigulda
Sigulda.summary: Sigulda is administratively in the Riga region, however culturally a part of the Vidzeme region.
Sigulda.description: – A town in central Latvia with many interesting castles and historic points of interest. Probably, the most popular destination outside of Riga for foreign tourists, also due to its closeness.

Tiberias.title: Tiberias
Tiberias.summary: Tiberias (Hebrew Teveriyah טבריה) is a large resort town on the western shore of the Sea of Galilee in northern Israel.
Tiberias.description: – a modern resort town with an ancient background, on the western shore of the Sea of Galilee

Waterford.title: Waterford
Waterford.summary: Waterford is the oldest city in Ireland and is famous for its crystalware and intriguing medieval history.
Waterford.description: (Port Láirge) — Ireland's oldest city. In the south-east and close to the ferry port at Rosslare. Waterford is a popular visit for those who want to learn more about the most ancient history of Ireland. It is quite possibly one of the best cities in the country as it is not too large and is full of history. Many festivals take place throughout the year including Spraoi. The food is good and the Granary Museum is the best for ancient Irish history in the country. Don't forget to try a blaa before you leave (a floury bread bun peculiar to this area of Ireland).

Daugavpils.title: Daugavpils
Daugavpils.summary: Daugavpils is the second largest city in Latvia, after Riga.
Daugavpils.description: – The second largest city in Latvia, after Riga. It is a delightfully charming, spacious, green city with the biggest fortress in Europe, which has withstood many many wars and remains virtually unchanged since its construction in the 19th century.

Riga.title: Riga
Riga.summary: Riga is the financial, creative, and cultural center of Latvia. It is the capital and the largest city in Latvia, it is also the largest city in the Baltic States. The city lies on the Gulf of Riga, at the mouth of Daugava, Riga has an population of approximately 640,000 inhabitants, or 1/3 of the population of Latvia. The city was part of many empires throughout history, each of which has left its mark on the city. It is famous for Art Nouveau and wooden architecture. Riga's historical center is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site.
sights: Museum of the Occupation of Latvia
Riga.description: – The capital city of Latvia and the European Capital of Culture in 2014 with a long history.

Dead Sea (Jordan).title: Dead Sea (Jordan)
Dead Sea (Jordan).summary: The Dead Sea (Hebrew: ים המלח, Hebrew transliteration:Yam HaMelach; Arabic: البحر الميت, Arabic transliteration: al-Bahir al-Mayyit) has its eastern coast in Jordan. It is the lowest point in the world at 394.6 m (1269 ft) below sea level.
Dead Sea (Jordan).description: the lowest point on earth and the most saline sea

Kish Island.title: Kish Island
Kish Island.summary: Kish Island is a beautiful island and tourist resort located on the north east of the Persian Gulf (Khalij-e Fars) about 17 km (10.2 miles) from the southern offshore of the mainland Iran. Kish is a free trade zone.
Kish Island.description: (Persian: کیش‎‎) – a free trade zone in the Persian Gulf, it is regarded as a consumer's 'paradise', with numerous malls, shopping centres, tourist attractions, and resort hotels. There is also Iran's first marina on the east side of the island.

Montego Bay.title: Montego Bay
Montego Bay.summary: Montego Bay, commonly referred to as MoBay, is the second largest city in the island nation Jamaica, a member of the British Commonwealth.  Montego Bay is the capital of St. James Parish, one of the 14 parishes of Jamaica.
Montego Bay.description: filled with historical sites and monuments, Montego Bay is the second city of Jamaica.

Makassar.title: Makassar
Makassar.summary: Makassar, formerly called Ujung Pandang, is the capital of South Sulawesi province. It has the largest population of any city on the island of Sulawesi, Indonesia, and is the fifth largest city in Indonesia after Jakarta, Surabaya, Bandung and Medan. The city is on the southwest coast of Sulawesi, facing the Makassar strait. It is regarded as the gateway to the eastern part of Indonesia.
Makassar.description: (Ujung Pandang) — the gateway to Sulawesi and home of the regionally famous Bugis seafarers

Houay Xai.title: Houay Xai
Houay Xai.summary: Houay Xai (also Huay xai, Houei Sai, etc) is the capital of the Laos province of Bokeo. It lies on the banks of the Mekong River, which forms the border to Thailand.
Houay Xai.description: in the north, on the Mekong and the border with Thailand

Pompeii.title: Pompeii
Pompeii.summary: Pompeii is in Campania, Italy, not far from Naples. Its major attraction is the ruined ancient Roman city of the same name, which was engulfed by Mt. Vesuvius in AD 79. This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Pompeii.description: and Herculaneum (Italian: Ercolano) — two suburbs of Naples covered by an eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in AD 79, now excavated to reveal life as it was in Roman times

Limerick.title: Limerick
Limerick.summary: Limerick (Irish: Luimneach) is a city in Ireland's Shannon Region.
Limerick.description: (Luimneach) — a city strategically sited where the river Shannon broadens into its mighty estuary in the south-west of the country. First city to receive the designation of National City of Culture (2014).

Bandung.title: Bandung
Bandung.summary: Bandung is the capital city of West Java province, and the third largest city in Indonesia after Jakarta and Surabaya. Nicknamed Parijs van Java (Paris of Java) by the Dutch for its resemblance to Paris and European atmosphere back at the colonial times, it is locally called as Kota Kembang, literally meaning the Flowery City because Bandung had a lot of flowers  in the colonial era and republic era up to the early 1960s.
Bandung.description: university town in the cooler highlands of Java

Sligo.title: Sligo
Sligo.summary: Sligo (Sligeach in Irish, meaning shelly place) is the principal town in County Sligo in Northwest Ireland & Lakelands. It's the largest urban area in this region, and the second largest in the province of Connacht (after Galway).
Sligo.description: (Sligeach) — Home to W.B. Yeats, internationally renowned poet. Mountains and beaches, scenery in general are the best points of Sligo.

Madaba.title: Madaba
Madaba.summary: Madaba  is a small town in central Jordan located south of the capital Amman on the King's Highway, some 10 km from Hesban.
Madaba.description: known for its mosaic map of Jerusalem and the Holy Land

Letterkenny.title: Letterkenny
Letterkenny.summary: Letterkenny is the largest town in Donegal, with a population of about 18,000. With adequate road infrastructure, the city boasts a good nightlife with plenty of third-level college students to create a lively atmosphere. It has plenty of decent pubs, and more than enough places to eat, to suit all ages. It is popular with hen and stag parties. Letterkenny is a major shopping destination of the North-west, though Derry in Northern Ireland is larger.
sights: Cathedral of St. Eunan and St. Columba
Letterkenny.description: (Leitir Ceanainn) — Main town in County Donegal, designated gateway status and reputed to be the fastest growing town in Europe. Good base for travelling in Donegal.

Taormina.title: Taormina
Taormina.summary: Taormina (Sicilian: Taurmina) is a town in the province of Messina on the east coast of Sicily.
Taormina.description: a charming hillside town on the east coast of Sicily

Baghdad.title: Baghdad
Baghdad.summary: Baghdad (Arabic: بـغداد Baġdād) is the capital of Iraq.
sights: The Monument to the Unknown Soldier

Ventspils.title: Ventspils
Ventspils.summary: Ventspils is a city in Kurzeme on the western coast of Latvia and one of Europe's busiest ports.
Ventspils.description: – A modern and artistic sea resort city in the north-west part of Latvia, has many things to see, and is one of the tidiest places in the region. A long-stretching beach and recreational park provide everything for a relaxing holiday week or weekend. It gets its prosperity from the huge ice-free port, which is the busiest port in the Baltic states, and the oil transit business.

Wadi Rum.title: Wadi Rum
Wadi Rum.summary: Wadi Rum is a spectacularly scenic desert valley (wadi in Arabic) in southern Jordan. It is also known as "Valley of the Moon" and inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.
Wadi Rum.description: barren, isolated and beautiful, granite cliffs contrasting with desert sand

Beer Sheva.title: Beer Sheva
Beer Sheva.summary: Be'er Sheva (also spelled Beersheba, Hebrew באר שבע) is a desert city of approximately 200,000 inhabitants in southern Israel. It is the sixth largest city in the country and the gateway to the Negev region of Israel. It is well known to readers of the Bible, but the modern city was only founded in 1900.
Beer Sheva.description: – the de facto capital of the Negev region

Prizren.title: Prizren
Prizren.summary: Prizren, in Kosovo, is a charming city of mosques and monasteries dating back to the 14th century. Happily spared (mostly) from both the "destroy the old, build the new" drive of the communists during the early years of their rule in Yugoslavia, as well as the ethnic and religious atrocities that plagued the Western Balkans in the last decade of the 20th century, Prizren has the best-preserved old town in the country by far, and is often referred to as the cultural capital of Kosovo.
Prizren.description: The most historical city in Kosovo. It has plenty of examples of beautiful Islamic architecture.

Savannakhet.title: Savannakhet
Savannakhet.summary: Savannakhet (ສະຫວັນນະເຂດ, commonly abbreviated to "Savan") and more officially mentioned as "Kaysone Phomvihane" (ໄກສອນ ພົມວິຫານ, name of the district), is the capital of Savannakhet Province in Southern Laos. It is on the Mekong River. With an estimated population of 120,000 it is the second largest city of Laos. The city is the hub between west (Mukdahan, Thailand) and east (Vietnam), and between north (Vientiane) and south (Pakse).
Savannakhet.description: in the south on the Mekong, connected by bridge to Mukdahan in Thailand

Golan Heights.title: Golan Heights
Golan Heights.summary: The Golan Heights is a rocky plateau at the southern end of the Anti-Lebanon Mountains, and straddles the borders of Syria and Israel. Israel holds about two-thirds of the territory, which it captured in the 1967 Six-Day War and annexed in 1981, while Syria holds the remaining one-third.
Golan Heights.description: – remains of a medieval fortress in the northern Golan Heights, 800 meters above sea level.

Aqaba.title: Aqaba
Aqaba.summary: Aqaba (العقبة al-ʿAqabah) is Jordan's only port city. It is on the Gulf of Aqaba in the extreme south of the country.
Aqaba.description: located on the Gulf of Aqaba (Eilat), with links to the Sinai and the Red Sea

Lower Galilee.title: Lower Galilee
Lower Galilee.summary: The Lower Galilee (Hebrew: הגליל התחתון HaGalil HaTahton, Arabic: الجليل al-Jalīl) is a region of northern Israel.
Lower Galilee.description: – a Crusader fortress on a ridge in the eastern edge of the Galilee.

Yazd.title: Yazd
Yazd.summary: Yazd is a desert city in central Iran and the capital of the Yazd province. It is an ancient city dating back to the Sassanian period (224-651 AD). It is nicknamed "the City of Windcatchers" in Persian, and in 2017 it was listed by UNESCO as a world heritage.
Yazd.description: (Persian: یزد‎‎) – a remote desert city – circumstance influenced special architectural themes where water streams run in underground rooms in houses and wind-towers to keep them cool.

Bromo-Tengger-Semeru National Park.title: Bromo-Tengger-Semeru National Park
Bromo-Tengger-Semeru National Park.summary: Bromo-Tengger-Semeru National Park is in East Java, Indonesia.
Bromo-Tengger-Semeru National Park.description: some of the scariest volcanic scenery on the planet and one of the best locations in the world to see the sunrise

Kingston (Jamaica).title: Kingston (Jamaica)
Kingston (Jamaica).summary: Kingston, the capital and largest city of Jamaica, nestled on the southeastern coast of the island.
Kingston (Jamaica).description: the capital and largest city in Jamaica.

Nagasaki.title: Nagasaki
Nagasaki.summary: Nagasaki (長崎) is the capital of Nagasaki prefecture on the island of Kyushu, Japan.

links.text: Kamome (かもめ) Limited Express train service

sights: Basilica of the Twenty-Six Holy Martyrs of Japan (Nagasaki)
Nagasaki.description: ancient port city with a unique blend of Chinese, Japanese, and European influences.

Jerusalem.title: Jerusalem
Jerusalem.summary: Jerusalem (Hebrew: ירושלים Yerushalayim, Arabic: القدس al-Quds)  is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
Jerusalem.description: – Israel's capital; a city sacred for millennia to the three Abrahamic religions (Jews, Christians and Muslims), and full of historic sites

Karakol.title: Karakol
Karakol.summary: Karakol (Каракол) is a city in Kyrgyzstan on the east of Lake Issyk Kul.
Karakol.description: – One of the gems of Issyk Kul, this was originally a Slavic settlement with a wealth of hiking, outdoor and sports available, including the Altyn Arashan hot springs, Karakol Canyon, and the beautiful Ala Kul glacier lake.

Balykchy.title: Balykchy
Balykchy.summary: Balykchy (Балыкчы) is a city at Issyk Kul.
Balykchy.description: – The gateway to Issyk Kul lake. A small, dying industrial center on the western shore, and a former fishing town, with a train service from Bishkek through a beautiful passant Chui Valley.

Fallujah.title: Fallujah
Fallujah.summary: Fallujah (Arabic: الفلّوجة, Aramaic: Pumbeidtha) is a city in Iraq's Baghdad Belts.
Fallujah.description: (الفلّوجة) — a city with over 200 mosques now better known for the sieges and battles fought here.

Bolaven Plateau.title: Bolaven Plateau
Bolaven Plateau.summary: Bolaven Plateau (ພູພຽງບໍລະເວນ Pupyang Bolaven) is in Southern Laos.
Bolaven Plateau.description: highland with waterfalls, jungles and farmland

Isfahan.title: Isfahan
Isfahan.summary: Isfahan (Persian: اصفهان, also known as Esfahan) is a city in central Iran, south of Tehran and is the capital of Isfahan Province. The Persians call it Nesf-e Jahan, meaning "Half of The World". Due to its beautiful hand-painted tiling and magnificent public square, it is considered to be one of the most beautiful cities in the world. An ancient town and capital of Persia from 1598 to 1722, it was long noted for its fine carpets and silver filigree. Today, textile and steel mills take their place. Its architecture, tree-lined boulevards and relaxed pace make it one of the highlights of Iran.
Isfahan.description: (Persian: اصفهان‎) – a former capital with stunning architecture, great bazaar, and tree-lined boulevards. Most popular tourist destination in the country. There's a Persian saying that "Isfahan is half the world."

Tarawa.title: Tarawa
Tarawa.summary: Tarawa is an atoll in the central Pacific Ocean, and the location of the capital of Kiribati.
Tarawa.description: atoll in the central Pacific Ocean

Milan.title: Milan
Milan.summary: Milan (Italian: Milano; Milanese: Milan) is financially the most important city in Italy, and home to the Borsa Italiana stock exchange. It is the second most populous city proper in the country, but sits at the centre of Italy's largest urban and metropolitan area. While not considered as beautiful as some Italian cities, having been greatly destroyed by Second World War bomb raids, the city has rebuilt itself into a thriving cosmopolitan business capital. In essence, for a tourist, what makes Milan interesting compared to other places is that the city is truly more about the lifestyle of enjoying worldly pleasures: a paradise for shopping, football, opera, and nightlife. Milan remains the marketplace for Italian fashion – fashion aficionados, supermodels and international paparazzi descend upon the city twice a year for its spring and autumn fairs.
Milan.description: (Italian: Milano) — one of the main fashion cities of the world, but also Italy's most important centre of trade and business

Hawalli.title: Hawalli
Hawalli.summary:
Hawally is the capital of the Hawalli Governorate, a district in the State of Kuwait, about 6 km south of Kuwait City. 
Hawally is a large suburb and the commercial center for most computer-related goods in Kuwait. Prior to the first Gulf War, it housed a large number of Palestinians, but many were expelled after the war. Hawally is home to many of the Arab and other expat populations in Kuwait. 
Hawalli governorate's population as of June 30, 2012 was 820,802 residents.
Hawalli.description: the closest southern suburb, about 10 minutes by car

Sapporo.title: Sapporo
Sapporo.summary: Sapporo (札幌) is the capital and largest city of the northern island of Hokkaido, Japan.
Sapporo.description: largest city in Hokkaido, famous for its snow festival

Vang Vieng.title: Vang Vieng
Vang Vieng.summary: Vang Vieng (ວັງວຽງ) (also Vang Viang) is a riverside town in Central Laos.
Vang Vieng.description: backpacker hangout for exploring limestone caves and tubing on the Nam Song river

Pakse.title: Pakse
Pakse.summary: Pakse (ປາກເຊ) is the capital city of Champasak province in Southern Laos, a small but relatively modern and friendly population center near the borders with Thailand and Cambodia.
Pakse.description: gateway to the Wat Phu ruins and the "four thousand islands" (Si Phan Don)

Erbil.title: Erbil
Erbil.summary: Erbil (Hawlêr in Kurdish and also transliterated as Arbil) is the capital and largest city in Iraqi Kurdistan, and the fourth-largest city in Iraq. It is one of the oldest continually-inhabited sites of human civilization, and is also a rapidly-growing and urbanizing center for the oil industry and NGOs in the Middle East.

Sendai.title: Sendai
Sendai.summary: Sendai (仙台) is the largest city, with around 1 million people, in the Tohoku region of Japan's Honshu island.
Sendai.description: largest city in the Tohoku region, known as the city of forests due to its tree lined avenues and wooded hills

Petra.title: Petra
Petra.summary: Petra (Arabic: البتراء, Al-Batrāʾ), the fabled "rose red city, half as old as time", is a well known ancient Nabataean city in the south of Jordan. Due to its breathtaking grandeur and fabulous ruins, Petra was recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1985.
Petra.description: Jordan's top attraction, an ancient city carved out of sandstone and one of the new 7 Wonders of the World

Tabriz.title: Tabriz
Tabriz.summary: Tabriz (Persian: تبریز, Azerbaijani: Təbriz) is the capital of East Azerbaijan province, in the Azerbaijan region of Iran. It is a modern industrialized Iranian city with signs of civilization dating back 2,500 years. Having some of most famous museums, holding some of the cultural events, and harboring a couple of the most prestigious Iranian universities, the city is considered a major hub for science and culture in Iran. Tabriz was named by the Organization of Islamic Conference as the "city of the Islamic world tourism" for 2018.
Tabriz.description: (Persian: تبریز) – a former capital with a great historical bazaar, now a provincial capital in western Iran; it's been suggested that this is the site of the Biblical "Garden of Eden"

Nur-Sultan.title: Nur-Sultan
Nur-Sultan.summary: Nur-Sultan (formerly known as Astana, Aqmola and Tselinograd), in the north of Kazakhstan, is the second largest city in the country.
sights: National Museum of the Republic of Kazakhstan
Nur-Sultan.description: (formerly Astana) — second largest city, and capital since 1997. Worth visiting but you only need a few days to get to the most worthwhile sights. This city is brand new and being built very rapidly. If you want to see what the old Aqmola looks like, you need to do it now as it is disappearing very rapidly.

Haifa.title: Haifa
Haifa.summary: Haifa (Hebrew חֵיפָה Heifa; Arabic حَيْفَا Ḥayfā) is the third largest city in Israel and the largest city in the north of the country with a population close to 300,000.
